Csg_4VZdD79_0LBwi_fmLw.text: I've been in Phoenix for 3 years now. Being from Chicago so many people told me to try PB. Magazines, tv shows, Oprah all say this pizza is the best. Well, don't believe the hype. The pizza was good, but not the best. There are so many varieties of pizza: thin crust, super thin crust, thick crust, deep dish, white pizza, etc. PB makes a basic, simple, light pizza with fresh and few ingredients. I would nominate it for the freshest pizza, but again not the best.

P9uZclfHETPkSxgCFk1faQ.text: Some of the best pizza I have even had. The crust was crunchy  (with out being overly chewy), and yet light and delicious. Loved the sauce, fresh mozzarella and the bundle of basil. (I ordered the margarita pizza).   Beautiful day so we sat on the patio. Friendly service, always had everything we needed. I have to agree with Gayle King (Oprah's best friend)this is some of the best pizza in the USA. Soooo good!!!!

xQpkdC7dJIbNnpCDc9IY9A.text: Hands down the best Pizza west of the Mississippi..The Bianco family are as welcoming a host as I have ever experienced. A mutual friend who spent many years on the Jersey shore recommended this place to me, and I am glad she had.. The kicker is, they are moving to my hometown of Tucson.. can not wait

2tk13fo_rUIRowt85btqpA.text: Still has great pizza but the service was horrible this time around.  I'm amazed at how managers can stand and watch problems arise and do nothing about it.  I'll have to think twice about returning.

7CNnzMIrdGbYweB9OPzWOg.text: After hearing all the great reviews, finally decided to go there last night with a couple of my kids.  I really don't understand why people love this place.  The pizza is just okay. I had the wise guy. The crust is crispy (just how I like it) but nothing else special about the pizza.  My kids had pasta and both were happy.   I would rather go to Grimaldi's, Oreganos, or LGO for pizza.  Also, the bill with tip was about $80 and we drank water.  That is a little steep for pizza and pasta for one adult and 2 kids.

QEFykLi7ReYyMy8Dj-JRbA.text: Another excellent meal. Word is getting out around town about this place...last time we went, it was early-ish on  Saturday and there were maybe two or three other couples there. Tonight, Saturday, we arrived at 5:45 and were told it would be over an hour without a reservation. Fortunately, there were two seats at the bar, so we didn't have to wait.   The food was, again, spot on and delicious. The service was great and gracious, and Bianco was greeting and thanking diners left and right.   The choices are limited (or possibly nonexistent) for strict vegans, but there's always something vegetarian on the menu if you don't mind being a little flexible on the cheese thing.  We shared the chickpea-flour crepe with olive, sage and red onion. This was fabulous, reminiscent of a potato pancake but more delicate.   I ordered the Fresh pasta with eggplant ragu, which was velvety with deep, garlicky, parmesan, and husband had the gnocchi with fresh corn. Also terrific.  There's a rotating menu, but I think there's always some variation of a bean side dish. Get it. The two we've had have been excellent. Also, the flourless chocolate cake is a must, and I think they have it every night.   Really, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

KQpNxfIBdNuzh5xCneazdQ.text: I really dig this place. I work nearby and have been for lunch on a few occasions- all really great experiences. I always get the pizza but my friend ordered the pah-sta (It's how my English friends says pasta. It's adorable.) and she said that was really great, too.  Also, I've only ever had nice babe waiters so the service has always been solid.

_9OSzIWmxn_XV8gFR_5u6A.text: Absolutely delicious! Best Italian food I've ever had. My friend and I purposely did not eat all day so we could really go all out. It was my first time but we went because she raves about the food. We got the margherita pizza, gnocchi and paperdelle. All that was left were about 5 gnocchi when we were done. The bolognese sauce was outstanding, pasta was cooked to perfection. The gnocchi were the softest, most pillow-y I've ever had and some had a light crispness on the outside. The pizza was incredibly fresh and light. I wish we had one of these in California because I would go all of the time. The outside patio is so cute for a date night. You won't be disappointed!

kwec9SrFvYUiahLDYcUotA.text: Took my significant other for a date night on his birthday and all the credit got back to me! And to Tyler Florence a bit! We LOVED it! We had the Spiedini for app, and then the pizza.. Oh the pizza! Crust - amazing, the crunch of the pistachios - also amazing, perfectly bake for a satisfying bite! Great selection of wines and also decent array of beers on tap. Ended it with a piece of chocolate cake and the night was just made more perfect...

pno0fiDga9jzENxT9FKbAw.text: I hate not being able to give this place at least four stars, but there some issues.  Like others have mentioned there are some issues with service. I wouldn't say they are rude but definitely not friendly either. My friend and I were sharing a chocolate cake and a waiter( not even ours) came by and took the empty plate literally as soon as I put down my fork without even asking.  At first, I thought some random stranger took something off the table until the guy walked into the back.  The food has very high quality ingredients and you can really taste the quality. That being said, this is not regular pizza. It seems more like something you might eat in Italy. Some people might like Americanized pizza better. I do.   Finally, the menu is small. Very small. Not many choices. The wine selection is much larger than their food menu.

pwuKBHda1EFEmHVBNNgJiw.text: This is what it's all about! Food that fills your mouth and soul with flavors that you didn't know existed. The spaghetti was cooked perfectly! I didn't know spaghetti could taste this fresh and satisfying. Best lasagna ever with the perfect blend of cheeses and whatever else of goodness they put in it. Just ordered tres leches cake and rice pudding for dessert. I can't wait!

8rm4FSQFMPH8KW1H8S4yag.text: Okay, regardless of the review mix I was all set to really like this place. I had a great experience at the place the owner used to own downtown and boy I was primed. I even took some friends and the father is Italian so I could make sure I had an even perspective but at the end it was sort of...eh, okay, but we've both had lots better.  The restaurant is right in the same shopping center as the Trader Joe's near Camelback avenue in North Phoenix, and that is a pretty cool place. The restaurant is set up as a sort of casual rustic italian sort of place, like the ones I've seen in Naples and that is a nice bit of Italian drama theater, though taking it to the point of serving the wine in small water glasses, a little too authentic. If I'm going to buy a decent bottle of wine, give me a real wine glass. Sorry if it blows the mood but its not the same without a decent wine glass.  I started out with the watermelon and fennel salad, as it seemed it would be cool and refreshing for summer and while it was okay, a bit warm for my tastes, I would have liked it a bit more chilled...wait...sorry, review unfinished and that was a few weeks ago so.....lets just say, relative to the price, I didn't think it was all that great, nothing I had felt like this place was worth a second visit.

tEuzBoE4W0O2uhWbFcOoCQ.text: We had such a lovely lunch at this location! We split the special pasta of the day and a pizza and it was the perfect amount of both. I'm so happy my husband works near here so we can go more often! It was delish and quant!

WeIDIUOwNQeawTpZzN_oBQ.text: Fantastic pizzas. Truly fantastic crust. Service was great and waiter willing to work with me on wine choice. Here for a few more days and may need to make another visit for my last meal here in Phoenix.

8CC9nmS47-9adzGPD1UIxg.text: just order one of every pizza.  best way to handle it.  you probably want to go with a group big enough to eat all that pizza, but they're so damn good you won't have trouble....

FcAoVcImp-DPkpf9BR6yVQ.text: Good pizza, good service, a little pricey, you even have to pay for their own parking, but I will come back when I crave for their biancoverde pizza.

7J8lN9k4zFmvonOrwLrzSw.text: Pizza was good. Just good! After reading an article online that touted this place the number 3 pizza place in the US I had to try. I think the food would have tasted better if the prices were more reasonable!

imuPpp8hszrOvQE3Pe37MQ.text: Excellent meal! Cheese plate was wonderful - mostarda, grilled dates and a perfect trio of cow, goat and sheep cheese selections.      Gnocchi - Phenomenal, fluffy pillows of perfection in a beautiful pork Ragu.  Fettuccine with lemon, olive oil, Parmesan and kale - hello summer! And last but not least - lovely, melt in your mouth meatballs! Love it!

1zoSDBX9jRAwxxUGtH4qRg.text: I was excited to hear Bianco opened a new restaurant at Town and Country. It was Monday and I didn't bring my lunch to work so I thought I'd treat myself and check it out right away!   Sort of disappointed. I was craving really good homemade pasta. I got the potato gnocchi and I thought was going to be a bolognese sauce but it was more of a chopped/shredded pork sauce (I wouldn't really call it sauce) with heavy citrus and parsley flavor (maybe I misread the menu). Anyways, it wasn't what I was hoping for - pretty heavy for a hot day in May!  I ordered the bread/olive oil too.  And just water. With a tip it came to $20.   Just a little more than I'd like to pay - even when I'm treating myself - but I'm willing to do it if it's good and I'm craving it!   Don't think I'll be coming back anytime soon. And I'll definitely either wait until it is cooler and the heavy entrees are more appropriate or I'll order a salad!  Also the service could be a little better. It wasn't very crowded so I got a table right away but it did take awhile to place my order. I asked my waitress what were the best pastas and was hoping she would have explained them in some more detail. She just said the gnocchi was her favorite and I went with that. Next time I'll be asking more questions for sure!   On a positive note, I love the location, decor and atmosphere.  Just wonder if it's a little too pricey/specialized for that location, considering what else is in that complex. The neighboring restaurants aren't really on the same level, attracting the same people.   But, I wish them luck and hope to find something to RAVE about next time I venture to try it again!

yGAKft4oqp1g6p2uQiNqqA.text: Had to try this place based on hype and really wanted to love it as it's close by and we love quality.  Unfortunately, the service killed the experience for us.  The place just didn't make us feel overly welcome and the pizza came out without the toppings we asked for.  The server offered it up on the side which took about 5 extra minutes which is fine but they then charged us separately for the addition.  When we asked to split the bill 3 ways at the end, the server took the tab back seemingly hastily.  Not a super friendly feel here.  The pizza was good but can get better for the high price.  No desire to return to this place.

7KoQpcTOEQ7gyf5kWsAoww.text: I ordered my pizza to go. It was delicious. I didn't realize it was brick oven pizza when I got it. The cooks and the manager were so nice when I came to pick it up. They scooped parmesan and red chili flakes into little containers for me to take. The crust was really good! Nice bite to it really. I got the Sonny Boy. It came with salami, olives and mozzarella. So tasty!! I would have taken a pic but I was so hungry that I ate it before I remembered. Highly recommend! Fast service, friendly and really good brick oven pizza!

0cY04DcBSA7j4s0BenMCoQ.text: It's good, it's cute it's even fancier but it's nothing compared to the downtown location.  If you're in the neighborhood you won't go wrong going here though.

QQC-aDMOe6UKPNGoAxDPYA.text: Their crust is thinner than it used to be (as thin as crust can possibly be now) plus the Wise Guy and Sonny Boy are now $19. No Thanks. At some point I must consider value, and for $19 I'll go to Johnnie's on Cave Creek and feed 3 hungry people (and almost a better pizza). 2 stars for still a delicious product, but I will not be back. Another unfortunate example of increasing price but decreasing quality.

M_Ajj5r7icrBXQgo5HnK_w.text: Sight lines from the outside walkway into the kitchen. Simple, rustic farm style decor. The food simple, subtle, pure and pretty much True to what you might find in Italy.  Start with hot bread with olive oil excellent. Had the sonnny boy pizza, great crust, each item on the pizza just added the right flavor especially the olives.  Got the papparadelle and again simple yet the bolognese and the parmesean just make it True touts Italian roots.

d6FZCcixFg-49Ix4y7KZNw.text: It's been awhile since we've been in, but the food was amazing!  Great, if not the best, pizza crust and cooked to perfection in brick oven!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza no cheese!  Delicious!  Sauce is majorly tasty!

ihyw1knCjQkaGeJJEi75qQ.text: (Lyrics - Phil Collins - In The Air Tonight)  I can taste it going to Bianco tonight, Bo Bites And I've been waiting for this location to open all my life, Bo Bites Can you taste going to Bianco tonight, Bo Bites, Bo Bites  Well, if you told me you were hungry I would lend a hand I've seen your appetite before my friend But I hope you know who I am  Well, I was there and I saw what you did I saw it with my own two eyes So you can wipe off your mouth I know what you've eaten It's all been a plate of pies (pizza)  Came here for a quick HH drinks with a buddy!  However, when in Pizzeria Bianco you have to order a pizza!  It would be sacrilegious not to!  I'm not too fond of the draft selections since there were only 2, but I guess I shouldn't expect too much from a wine and pizza joint.  We ordered the Margarita Pizza.  Overall, it was pretty good - firewood baked pizza pie in a stone oven; you really can't beat that quality!  The aroma of the basil, the stringy mozzarella cheese, and the sweetness of the tomato sauce is enhanced by the toasty smell of the firewood! Yum!    The service was very good!  There were several people that attended to us, but seem like they were all in sync and willing to help to make our experience so much better!  The place itself is different from the one downtown.  This one had more of a farm home feel with a touch of spring!  In the end, a must visit next time your around the Biltmore area! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8C5JMUG0le9DmsZ448hiHg.text: Thw Wise guy was Excellent along  with the sonny boy & margarita pizza. Cant image making any better . awesomeness

AewqZvpDay5DBMXbIXZEFw.text: The appetizers were great. Pizza was amazing. Service was impeccable. Cara was especially friendly and helpful.

1ftUADu3SQKS0FKO8t3EoQ.text: Love this place ! Great pizza! Best Bolognese pasta and great service always consistent!   I do recommend to try it you won't regret!

wChM2ZRDbk_UW5q5Tv-Shw.text: So i have to say....disappointing!  I have been wanting to come here for years!! Now in their defense, I hear the downtown location is better, but if you are going to Chain your establishment, you should be able to reproduce the same quality food.  It wasn't "bad", it just was not worth the money. I would prefer Federal Pizza, Humble Pie, Spinato's, ZPizza or Papa Johns and saved some mullah!  I may try downtown sometime, but I am not in a rush.

473fclmptKSDPxtnLjBFTg.text: Pizzeria Bianco has received raves, so I looked forward to lunch there.  17 members of my Miata Club descended upon Pizzeria Bianco for lunch. The  is large and comfortable, with several areas for individuals, small groups and larger groups, as well as ample outdoor seating. The wait staff is courteous and ly. We were all seated at a long table that accommodated all 17 of us. Everyone first received whatever drinks they wanted, most had either water or iced tea, plates of bread and oil were then served.  The menu is one page with only a few items, sandwiches, pasta, , salad. Our waitress started at one end and took everyone's order in turn. Then astonishingly, within 5 minutes of her leaving, food started to arrive. Within 10-12 minutes everyone was served whatever they ordered. This was the fastest service I can remember in a . Next, the food, I ordered one of the 5 s on the menu, the Margherita, a simple  with red sauce, cheese and basil. Others had a variety from the sandwich, salad and pasta offerings. My  was very good, the crust was the best part, brick over cooked. The crust was thin, crisp on the parameter and soft in the middle. Toppings were sparse and the first bite removed most of the cheese from the slice. The tomato sauce was good, but I had to add some red pepper to give it a little kick. There were six pieces of basil leaf on the . I did request some parmesan and red pepper which was readily supplied. There is only one size of , and I would say it is small. I ate the entire  and most others who ordered  also did. My bill for the  was $17 and change. Overall, for someone who has eaten  all over the country and the world, I would give this  a 7+ on a scale of 1 - 10. I did not see what all the excitement was about (although I only had the ) as there was nothing that was a standout about the . It was fresh, but could have been cooked about minute longer to make the crust a more overall consistent. I would have to try more off the menu to give Pizzeria Bianco a True encompassing , this  is just about the experience and the .  The  was crowded, everyone seemed happy to be there, received their orders very quickly and it certainly seemed that  was very good for a Wednesday afternoon.

vwWo0S4eETbZBT_bEbAaGg.text: Such great pizza!! Found this place while looking for some pizza while in town, and I was very impressed. 4 stars because the menu is a bit limited, but everything was delicious! The pizza is thin crust, and you could easily share it with someone along with an appetizer. This location has some pastas and entrees, which looked good. I went with the Rosa pizza - it was very rich, but very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wiseguy!

fi4TwkzOEnhT3obvDjSjmA.text: Really amazing Neapolitan style pizza made with fresh ingredients.  Crust is chewy but crisp and it's so very flavorful.  The pasta, too, is fantastic!!

_TKVkB9Z2yWR3C1W4s1U0g.text: I was really hungry and grouchy coming in Pizzeria Bianco for dinner.  The dining experience started off just a titch rough but everything worked out and I was very happy dining there.  The bread and pizza are amazing and may be the best bread I've ever had.  I especially appreciate that they're so vegan friendly.  The pizza is so good it really doesn't need any cheese.  The service people were all very welcoming and helpful.

S_q8hkGiTZO96hf3wrb-0g.text: Went to try Pizzeria Bianco in July and was sad to find out they were closed for the week! They didn't put anything on their website, Instagram, or phone recording about it. They only warned people via Facebook which I unfortunately did not see.  I was happy to be able to try this place again on Friday though..finally! Loved the shabby chic look, very cute. We were greeted by a friendly hostess, and our server was absolutely excellent as well. I got the Field Greens salad and me and my boyfriend split a pizza which was half Marinara (For me!) and half Sonny Boy.  I liked the bread they brought out, yum! The salad was $8 which seemed a little ridiculous for what we got. The greens tasted very fresh though. The dressing on it was a bit too salty for my taste, but it was edible. I was torn between getting the Margharita or Marinara, but decided I wasn't in the mood for cheese so I got the Marinara. The flavors of the marinara sauce with the fresh sliced garlic and basil was incredible. One complaint: the crust was a little too floppy and soggy towards the middle. The outer part was good though! My BF got the Flourless Chocolate Cake for dessert. I tried a bite, it was very rich. Pretty good, but the portion was very small for the price.  This is the only Pizzeria Bianco location that I have tried out, and I enjoyed it. I would be interested in trying the crazy busy downtown one!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Marinara Pizza Slice

lVJ4PIDa2-wmFkESvQzYxg.text: Food is good but not worth the so so service that we've encountered every time we visit. Recent dinner for bday party was disappointing. One member in group didn't receive their pasta so we mentioned this to the waitress. We continued waiting and as everyone almost finished their meals we again kindly mentioned to the waitress. Her response was "we already had this conversation". A simple "I'm sorry, I'll check again for you" would have been nice. Too bad she's miserable with her job.

jT2tX7RT6Goq6ljj4UZaGw.text: Good pizza!, but only one size, and 16-22 for a 12 inch is just a little too much! Its food but tasted better and and tasted worse, drinks and a salad!!, your talking 60-70 out the door, no thanks!!!

3fqRIObLHfeksDVjH3qiqA.text: Food was delicious wine amazing! And homemade lemon cello one of the best I eve had. But service was so bad! Never came back to check on us. It was more like a order taker.

10eib720JhZfyZ8BngO6vw.text: Came here without checking much into it, just knowing that my father had heard a lot of great things. Came here for a little dinner date with my wife and we both left satisfied and smiling. I had a glass of the Cab Sauvignon and we split the Margherita Pizza. Both were incredible.  If you're not fluent in Italian food language, I'd recommend checking the menu out ahead of time and googling anything you aren't sure about. Menus like this can get intimidating (personal experience haha).  Overall, I was very impressed with the quality, service was above average, and the atmosphere is perfect for a date or a group setting.

Gy1EMDn6otkHexY0AYqLRQ.text: This place is the bomb.com! It is so good, we go once a month and we always have a great time

MErZZcTzajrGAuCaRQk_uQ.text: I have actually been to Pizzeria Bianco a couple of times, and every single time, it is as delicious as the last. This time I took my fiance, as she has been wanting to go for quite some time. The service was fantastic, like we were usuals who come in often. They made her experience memorable. When it came to ordering, our server recommended the Sunday Gravy, and my fiance absolutely loved it. We ended up sharing that, and a 50/50 pizza. The food couldn't have been any better, and I look forward to taking her back again soon.

iY7gjGryeuyzMlUzENorYQ.text: The staff is friendly! The decoration is cute. The location is great. Pizza was tasty. I ordered the Biancoverde which had fresh mozzarella, parmigiano reggiano, ricotta, arugula and I added fennel sausage. It was pretty good, although I should of added prosciutto instead of the sausage. That was a fail on my part! The only bad thing is that they didn't have ranch and my pizza was slightly too toasty for my taste buds! Sad day. Cool place though!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Tuh-VHzUdSBwJR57_KVhSw.text: Expensive, but super cute place to go to. Came here with a friend and we shared a bottle of wine and a pizza. The pizza was fantastic. Wine was alright, a little pricier than I was expecting. But overall it was a cute place. Waiter was alright. He didn't seem all that interested in us though. He just acted funny with any questions I had. Otherwise everyone else was nice!

EWASMlxeEzoblrj8N0AXqw.text: I've been wanting to try this place since before it opened. Tonight I went with two girlfriends, and although we had a great time, I was completely unimpressed with the food.  I would give it five stars for the ambiance and decor - it's a quaint, rustic place and I loved everything about how it looks!  Be sure to dress warm though - they use the outside seating as the waiting area. There are a few heaters, but it's still chilly out! Thankfully, we only had to wait about 20 minutes.  For our starer, we ordered the salad with mozzarella, arugula and prosciutto and though the mozzarella was very good, the salad was somehow too salty. The bread and vinegar was delish. I believe my roommate said the vinegar was the best part of the meal - which I agree with. It was an extra $2, but if you're going to order bread, then it's worth it.  I ordered the spaghetti and was disappointed. I prefer angel hair pasta and this was thick pasta with nothing special to the sauce or noodles. Thankfully, we ordered a side of meatballs - those were amazing and really helped the spaghetti. I also tried the gnocchi that my friend ordered and thought it was terrible - very bland.   We all split the flourless cake for dessert. It was okay - but tasted more like a brownie than a cake. It had a pure coco flavor just lightly sweetened, which was unexpected but good. However, it would have been better if were truly a cake.  Since I live nearby and loved the atmosphere, I'll definitely be back, but hopefully will find something I like besides the meatballs, bread & vinegar.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. spaghetti
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. salad
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. meatball side

NnHuxOTJHElshR6xl-u5Hw.text: After waiting 25 minutes for our table, the hostess said that our table was ready.  However, I didn't expect to be seated with 2 other couples sharing a single table.  I didn't know about the communal seating.  I'm not sure if I like it either, especially for a nice sit down restaurant.  It turned out okay that night because the people we sat with were really friendly and talkative.  It's similar to getting seated on most of the cruise ships.  I guess I can understand why they have to do it like that.  The place is tiny.    The food was quite delicious though.    Here's what I tried.  Spaghetti with Tomato Sauce and Meatballs Caciucco Seafood Stew  The spaghetti was cooked perfectly.  The tomato sauce tasted really fresh and the meatballs were amazing.  The seafood stew was full of flavor but the serving was really small.  See photo.  It would have been nice if it was served with some bread or pasta.  Not very filling at all.    The dessert the night I went didn't sound very good so I took a pass on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caciucco Seafood Stew

km3ZUNhnJPTtSjSHkpL_XQ.text: My pizza was excellent - the margherita with the addition of mushrooms had lovely sauce and an excellent crust - and only a little high in price for a medium pie (to be expected for the Bianco name).  My husband ordered the spaghetti with pomodoro sauce, and, though the sauce was delightful, the pasta was a little heavy.  Unfortunately, our friend's pizza was far from impressive - she order the Rosa, and it was dry, dense and almost pungent (maybe this is some kind of acquired taste?).  The server was pleasant, the bread was delcious and the atmosphere is cute.  However, I think we'll be visiting the Parlor next time - the pizza is better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita with mushrooms, Rosa, bread with olive oil to start, House Red wine, Spaghetti. Some awesome, some just ok.
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita with mushrooms, Rosa, bread with olive oil to start, House Red wine, Spaghetti. Some awesome, some just ok.

mDuIjPHUmCIuzVmmQtF-tQ.text: Nothing inspires foodie passion quite like pizza, one of the world's most popular yet varied dishes.It tastes like no other pizza I've ever had but it was delicious and perfectly combined.pizzeria Bianca is the first restaurant I have been with my husband since I moved from India. So this restaurant holds special place in my heart. Great wine ,great pizza and great location.

DMNK0WBKXP15CbfdDZRo2Q.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said. The biancaverde was mindblowing. Try the pizza with the local Fennel sausauge. Good god why did I buy a house in Surprise. Next time I hire a realtor I'm making a request to find me a home with Pizzeria Bianco within walking distance.

ay-AIq-7H85-7QCDexasKA.text: This is obviously the best pizza ever. My choice of pizza is the Marinara (no cheese) with olives. It's BEYOND delicious. This is QUALITY pizza guys! I'm seeing all these reviews with complaints that the pizza is "burnt." It's called an brick oven, take your business elsewhere if you're gonna cry over this.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious! Marinara (no cheese) pizza w/ olives.

z7tICkh-2BaMu_An2EfJUw.text: My group suggested we try out this place for lunch. First impressions were good - chandeliers dangle above you and the walls are adorned with artwork and mirrors. The tables and chairs seem to be old wooden antiques which add a unique touch. However, you'll need an Italian dictionary to translate the menu. Not sure why they can't explain the food in English but I guess they wanted to portray a pretentious, upmarket vibe. I decided to keep it simple and ordered a margherita pizza to share with my wife. Disappointingly, the slices were literally wafer thin - I had never seen a pizza like this before - and you pay $15 for the privilege. In fact, everything on the menu seemed overpriced. I noticed a beer for $18 which I can only assume consisted of liquid gold.   The restaurant obviously aims to cater for wealthy socialites who place more emphasis on being seen eating in hip eateries while gossiping over wine rather than the food itself. My advice: go to Dominos instead, where you can get a large pizza for $7 that won't leave you starving afterwards.

wuqir02g5kkuRq0Pe89adQ.text: I am not a huge pizza person but i have been to most of the tops spots in Phoenix and everyone always says how this place is the best, so I had to try it out. I had the wise guy and the rosa pizza and to be totally honest they were just ok. The crust was burnt and was super thin, and the toppings were nothing special.  I have no idea why this place gets high rankings from everyone, although most people I noticed eating there were drinking. Drinking makes everything taste better.

ALGZCy5aNkXrlqCeJ4-oDQ.text: After years of boycotting the downtown location because of the arrogant service and ludicrous lines,we finally tried the new location on Camelback. The place looked like a hipster joint, with dim lighting and a long bar, where we waited about 5 minutes to be seated. We were led into the second room, which was completely different to the first room. It looked a Disney version of a French drawing room. Hardly what you would associate with a pizza joint. There was something lacking - the room was to big for the furniture, weirdly lit and just sort of ...empty.  Anyway we were seated at a window looking out on to the empty storefront across from the restaurant. The service was okay and our waiter explained the very small menu adequately.  I ordered a Margherita pizza with Fennel sausage added and my wife ordered he Biancoverde, a white pizza with several cheeses and some Arugula on top. Once the food was delivered no-one approached us at all to inquire as to our satisfaction or concerns  The bottom line is that the PIzza was underwhelming. In the years since Bianco first came to national attention and was named the best pizza in Phoenix, some serious competition has arisen, not least of which is Pomo in Scottsdale (with a small downtown offshoot), Grazie in Old Town Scottsdale and Il Bosco in mid Scottsdale, all who make much better authentic Neapolitan style PIzza than PB, and at reasonable, appropriate pricing for dough, cheese and some toppings.  We left feeling like we had wasted a hour and spent more money than we received value for.

JLrtMvVbnrXwViwUz4j0QQ.text: I love Pizza Bianco, but this location is really exceptional, if not mostly for its accessibility. Easy parking, in a much more interesting part of town/shopping center, and though I never have had to wait for a seat at the bar at Heritage Square, you're almost guaranteed to get a seat here any time of day. Much more user friendly all around; I haven't even bothered with the downtown Bianco in 2 years...   The space itself is much different than Heritage Square. Bigger, seating isn't nearly as tight, gorgeous bar and a more rustic country vibe than brick and mortar hole in the wall.   The pizzas are just as they are downtown, which is excellent. The Rosa, Sonny Boy and Wiseguy are all fantastic in their own right.  Always order 2 straight away, because another slice is inevitable when it's this good. Perfectly thin, crisp on the outside but airy on the inside crust that has just the right amount of chewiness. Good sauce, and top shelf cheese and toppings. They really fire on all cylinders when it comes to knocking out amazing pizzas.   Only a few beers on tap, but they're decent enough local brews that are adequate accompaniments. My girlfriend digs the espresso.   Service is always fairly good, but they are always busy, so some misses are par for the course from time to time.   If you love pizza, this is a must do. One of the best spots in the country for exceptional pizza.

twY-ic28jLluY6lgr5UL3g.text: Not worth all the hype. Good customer service, but selection is minimal and just ok tasting. ..nothing to write home about.

1kVfnPxlqmAk6ArIKxivNQ.text: I only gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I requested my pizza uncut and they cut it anyway. That being said, it was amazing! I grew up in Naples Italy and this reminds me of home. I had the margarita pizza and we started with a warm beet salad with goat cheese and a bottle of red wine recommended by our great waiter. It was a fabulous meal and I can't wait to go back! Oh and I can't forget the flourless chocolate cake, it was like eating a fudge truffle, rich and ridiculously good!

TeOo6CKxZi_DcK1xxH3CKw.text: I've loved Pizzeria Bianco more than I've loved some of my friends.  I'd never been to Bianco's Town & Country location until Thursday night... and I am kicking myself for it now.  We arrived just before 8:30 to the satellite of Pizzeria Bianco, which housed Bianco's Italian Restaurant and now is split into Trattoria Bianco and the pizzeria.   We chose to sit at the bar and order a pizza.  Of course, we ended up ordering my favorite pizza... the Biancoverde.  Additionally, we got curious about the Rustichella Spaghetti.  So... we ordered that, too.  The pizza arrived first and I am sure I was not the only one who heard it calling out sweet nothings to me as I took my first bite.  Perfection in a pizza?  Yes, I should say so.  Next, the spaghetti arrived.  It was unassuming, but I dug right in.  If I could have spoken... I would have screamed out a number of curse words followed by "That's the best pasta I have EVER had."    The spaghetti was so simple, but Bianco's pomodoro and parmesan sauce was perfection with the perfect heavy hand of basil.  I'm not even a basil fan... but it was amazing in this dish.  No joke, we nearly licked the plate clean of sauce.  That kind of goodness could never be replicated at home... unless perhaps I got the best parm, Bianco's tomatoes and the freshest basil from a heavenly garden.  Yes, yes, yes!  It was that good.  The ambience was great.  This place gives you a little more elbow room than the Adams St location.    Next up?  The Trattoria!

3mhVZxF4ePa0Z74DV_4s7g.text: Pizzaria Bianco has been on my list since getting Reinhart's book, American Pie and began the quest to make good pizza. I've spent time not only in the kitchen trying to recreate Italy from a long ways away, but also walking the streets of Rome eating pizza 4 times a day. On a scale of 10, my pizza gets a 5, average American pizza a 2-3, and pizzaria Bianco a 7-8. There is better in the world, but not much better in the USA. The Margaretta is the way to go, substantially better than the wise guy. Pricy, but not nearly as much as a trip to Italy.

h0A_7jiDh7sfgARLIrYLBQ.text: Just recently went for the first time after hearing about it for years. Bottom line: overpriced and underwhelmed. We took an out-of-town guest, was somewhat embarrassed. So far spinatos for the money is the best in my opinion.

owDqDPkA984MA3giFuTQDg.text: After trying Pizzeria Beddia in Philly, we wanted to check out Pizzeria Bianco in Phoenix - the place that started it all. And it did NOT disappoint! I had the margherita pizza with half mushrooms and it was delicious both ways. Thin, crisp crust with excellent "bite". My boyfriend had the Biancoverde - a white pizza with several cheeses and topped with an entire salad of arugula. We were a little surprised by the mountain of greens, but both fully agreed that the flavor addition was ideal to balance out the really pungent, flavorful cheeses. We ate there on Sunday night and had no wait at all. Ordered and had piping hot pies in front of us in - no lie - 7 minutes flat. We weren't hungry for dessert but the server told us to try the flourless chocolate cake. We followed his advice and I almost licked the plate clean. The vanilla cream sauce on the cake was divine. There was no downside to this meal!

9Sz5qZXTvB6AJ_1T8Fs6Hg.text: Great pizza and great service! My family and I were in town for spring training a few weeks back and were staying at a hotel next to this restaurant. Highly recommend and will return if back in the area.

JhlT2AOTPYS-GWQeFjrqCw.text: Italian New Yorker goes to Phoenix for pizza? What!! Got to say this was some of the best  I've ever had! Such a wonderful selection of pizzas that aren't your typical corner slice. Really enjoyed trying all the different kinds of pizzas. Look forward to are next visit!

_345X_g0R0sR6HYbRS06uQ.text: Visiting from California and this was the perfect date night spot. Quiet, romantic ambiance with excellent service. Small but quaint interior with cute rustic decor and most important, amazing dinner. We had the chicken cacciatore and pasta bolognese, both delicious and great portions. Highly recommend for authentic Italian dinner out

OAU5Wdf6wOwgmdi8INVILg.text: Of course the pizza and food is always phenomenal but what keeps us coming back is the exceptional service and atmosphere. Especially the warmth always shown by the manager, Torrey. Highly recommend this place!

bhnoHzprdwS7ASyE-jMtZA.text: Ah, I remember the first time I went to Pizzeria Bianco.  A group of us went to their downtown Heritage Square location and ordered every pizza and antipasto on the menu.  The one I fell in love with was the Rosa.  Rosa stole my heart.  So it's been quite a few good years since I last visited Pizzeria Bianco and we decided to stop by last night to rekindle the romance with Rosa and a Wiseguy.  Rosa (Red onion, parmesan, rosemary, AZ pistachios), $16:  Did you not read the description?  This pizza is DIVINE!  That parmesan is salty and granular so don't be expecting any cheese drag action.  I love the crunch the pistachio gives and that rosemary is subtle but fragrant.  This isn't your typical pizza and I love it.  Wiseguy (Wood-roasted onion, house smoked mozzarella, fennel sausage), $19:  The Wiseguy is everything you want in a pie.  The house-made mozzarella is so delicious and the fennel sausage is a flavor explosion.  Still a straight-forward and simplistipic pie that'll have your skirt flippin'!  This Biltmore location is decent.  It's bigger and more spacious but the service isn't so great.  The staff is more interested in talking to each other than checking on your meal.  I think I like the original Heritage Square location more.  What else can I say?  Chris Bianco is brilliant.  It's no wonder how he has won a James Beard Foundation Award for best Southwest Chef and no small feat that Pizzeria Bianco is named one of the best pizzerias in the country by Bon Appetit.  So come and get some pizza!  You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Wiseguy.
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Rosa.
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread and olive oil.

oHsTAyIOrldrodssEtC8QA.text: Omg!! This place is sooo delicious ! Went there twice, and both times it was amazing. All their dishes are really , really good (tried all my friend's dishes in addition to my own) ! First time I went I just had their spaghetti  with marinara sauce - so simple , but so good . I feel like you can usually tell how good a place is by their simplest dish . Second time I had the same spaghetti but this time I also had their pizza , and OMG , it was sooooo good ! My favorite pizza in all of Phoenix metro area  so far . I swear, once you try it , you will be craving it ! Enjoy!

9G7t2NjLpGVH2_tflCbTgQ.text: My son wanted me rate 5 stars because "I was full, but the pizza was so good, I had to eat the last piece in front of me".  Great pizza, great drinks, family friendly, superb service

q8lknYSN0oAsJKA_CUa_AQ.text: Pizzeria Bianco is always excellent. It's some of the best pizza I have ever had, no make that THE best. I grew up in New Jersey and New York City and have spent a considerable amount of time in Italy. Also, this is the only place I know of in Phoenix to get actual fresh mozzarella.

EvkjL4h2Bi0Dqd6aY3MJPQ.text: This place has not stood the test of time well... Let's start with the most important part, the food. On our recent visit we ordered the Wiseguy which has sausage and roasted onions, I also had this same pizza about 2 years ago...  Now when I originally had this pizza it was ok, I'd give it a 6/10, this time however I would give it a 1/10. Look at the picture, disgusting! The onions were just incredibly overwhelming and look like they were cut for a pizza 10x this size. I was also incredibly disappointed by the iced tea, it has this foul taste that I couldn't stand. I don't think I've ever been disappointed by something as simple as iced tea but there's a first time for everything.   The service was also incredibly slow. There was only one server working and the hostess didn't seem interested in helping him do anything. It took forever to get our drinks and the check.   There are much better alternatives, we will not be returning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3hgxV0zdMrPhSNRiQTYVCQ.text: I can't understand why this place gets rated as one of the best pizza places in the country?   The pizza is good but not that great!  I also found the service to be slow.  It seems as this place is living off of their old reputation.  Even the bathrooms were dirty.  Has the owner lost his passion for greatness?   I think so.

cskR47KsRlNPvEOxjFh1Tw.text: I wanted so bad to like this place.   The pizza was a bit on the sweet side and finding one that offered both meat and a red sauce wasn't easy. I went with the Sonny Boy which I enjoyed but my boyfriend found inedible.  The pizza was small, especially for the price, but at least the ingredients were very fresh. Like all Bianco locations, the ingredients are bought fresh from local farmers and prepared daily.   The location itself is lovely and airy, at night you almost feel like you're sitting at a bistro in a small village. During the day its filled with light from the large windows covering two walls, and the open door to the wrap around patio outside. These things would have been nice had they not meant that while sitting inside we were bombarded with flies and gnats.   The staff was very polite and excited to expand on anything we had questions about. I would still suggest this place to anyone looking for a nice date spot before hitting the movies or while shopping in the Biltmore.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonny Boy with complementary bread and olive oil

-dXuesQRTbS2Fb7vajkQpA.text: First time here and it was amazing! The pizza is very good. The drinks are amazing. The atmosphere is wonderful! I would definitely come back here next time I am in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza!!
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old fashion and wiskey sour

PD_4VHtrI0djA-ZDkPf5pQ.text: 3.5 stars  The last time my sister and I were in Phoenix, we ate at Cibo instead of Pizzeria Bianco. Years later, we found ourselves in Phoenix again with Pizzeria Bianco high up on our list of places to try.  We shared the following pies:  -margherita ($15): tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, basil. Hands down, this is probably the best margherita pizza I have ever had. The tomato sauce had a nice bite, and I loved how fresh the mozzarella tasted. I ate my pizza with bites of anchovy, so the saltiness of the anchovies added another layer of flavor.  -wise guy ($18): wood-roasted onion, house smoked mozzarella, fennel sausage. This pizza is sauceless, which didn't matter. I really liked the smokiness of the cheese, and the sausage had a good snap. I personally like the sweet tinge of the onions, but my sister wasn't a fan of their substantial size.  Our dining experience was lackluster. Our waiter was nice, but was not very informative. We overheard from the waiter from neighboring tables rattle off the history of the menu, the daily specials, and what was in season and what was not etc. Our lunch experience was curt and short.   Pizzeria Bianco was good, but not mind blowingly good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. margherita = $15
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. margherita + wiseguy pizzas
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. wiseguy: wood-roasted onion, smoked mozzarella, fennel sausage = $18

9Ykrhr3SflZfEAo8_tA59w.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the world. I found out about this restaurant when I discovered that one of my favorite chefs has a food crush on Chris Bianco. I order the Sonny Boy every single time we visit and I will never ever change my order. It's perfection. The ingredients are fresh. The texture is is phenomenal. The flavor is unbeatable.

w0m3_-V4vkV22J0ZG8EAhA.text: Haven't been to bianco's in years not much has changed set the price still real expensive for pizza but I guess the quality ingredients you pay for but still it's not one of my favorite pizza places or even the top 10 I had the Rosa which is okay good flavor but the dough just too soggy doesn't have that burnt flavor from the wood oven that would say or Smoky flavor would you expect from wood fired oven my wife had some pasta dish not sure the name of it had really thick noodles noodles were cooked very well just I didn't care for the sauce The Bolognese sauce is very light no real flavor probably be the last time at bianco's

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HOPLm1zpmhnHJJ9QeCc9vg.text: This is our go to place for occasions. The Sonny Boy Pizza is our favorite.We were seated in the front of the restaurant where the noise is louder but we still enjoyed the setting. The hostess, Harmony, was great and even ordered us a free dessert for our anniversary. This is by far the best pizza outside of Italy.

wv7HxIkFH49k3wLbWICF0g.text: It was not bad and priced moderately. Pizzas were fairly big and enough for a large person. Definitely enough for 2 petit eaters. They tend to over charr the crust so watch out for that. We did bring it to their attention and they were very prompt to bring us a new one. The papardelle and market salad were better than the pizzas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosa pizza
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Parpadelle with grass fed beef Bolognese
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Market salad

I4seVWus0N4qxkZqYGugUQ.text: After more than a few visits to this Pizzeria Bianco location, I can say that I'm a fan for sure...  The decor in this place if great - from the moment you walk in, you'll forget you're in a strip mall in Phoenix and feel more like you're dining in someone's house!  I've been here on dates with my husband, double dates, and even small groups, and I've never had a bad meal.  Service, food quality, and atmosphere are all consistently solid!  I typically go for some red wine with my meals at PB, but they have a cocktail menu also.    I recommend going here and eating family style.  Depending on the seasonal menu, start with a salad (I like the Simple Greens), and a few sides (ie: olives, vegetables and/or sausage).  Make sure you also get the fresh Bianco bread with olive oil!  From there, go for some pizza... We like the traditional Margherita and the Sonny Boy, but I don't think you can go wrong!  Lastly, try an entree or pasta or both... it's all good, I swear!  And if you have room, end with some of their homemade dessert!  Pizzeria Bianco has come a long way from having just their original downtown Phoenix location... I've been to all three Phoenix locations as well as the one in Tucson and never been disappointed.  Buon Appetito!

fFywNUQn9Y95fxSDnjRxNg.text: So glad this location opened up. Less of a wait without losing quality taste and service

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunday gravy, mmmhm beefy.

K4-I5HTWakEIp2RsTMZyrA.text: I used to love this place, but this recent experience soured me. I ordered the Rosa pizza.  The pizza arrived very quickly   The ingredients were not spread evenly on the pizza and the pizza was a greasy mess.  Of course I ate it without saying anything, but had regrets later on.  Just looked back on this experience and wondered if I would come here again.

nxPoWME6-G8cYbPDnycT2Q.text: My three stars is based solely on the pizza experience.  The customer service was 5 star, the atmosphere was right up there too!  The quality of the ingredients were 5 star.......so why wasn't the pizza all that it was hyped up to be?   For being Phoenix Magazines #1 pizza place, I am just shaking my head.  The pizza looked beautiful, but was just tasteless.  Sooooo disappointing! I am a huge LAMP fan, #2 on Phoenix Magazines  top 10 pizza list, I was looking so forward to seeing how this place kept LAMP at #2.   I ordered a half Wise guy and half margarita.  Super expensive too, but as I said the ingredients were quality, but nothing was seasoned, like at all.  From the crust to the sauce..... This place has a huge following and my little review here won't touch them, but I had to tell it like it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looks pretty,  but was tasteless.....

CPL5oq7MLNZVdf_v_FnGMg.text: We were looking forward to trying this place out as we've heard the hope for years. Perhaps if we had not had other experiences with Napolitano style pizza previously, we would have been happy.  The salad starter was just greens with a nice vinaigrette and some of the best olives I've ever had.  We tried the Sonnyboy and found the crust to be a good combo of chewy and crispy, but the sauce was bland and the sopressata was only ok and could've had a little more spice.  The service was good and appropriate, but not friendly.  I don't know that we will be back as there are other better napolitano style pizzas in the neighborhood.

KiG2VTjfwy6-xS8HXfXtjw.text: I only ever went to Bianco at its original location once. I vaguely recall a pizza that was pretty darn good - but that eating experience was so overwhelmed by the ridiculous 3-hour wait to be seated (and what can only be described as the "deeply unconcerned" attitude of the waitstaff) that I vowed to never go back.  Sometime between then and now (many, many years) I found Jeff Varasano's Neopolitan pizza website and fell in love with the pizzamaking process. I've had a lot of good Neopolitans too - and in Phoenix! Pizza a Metro, La Piazza - even Grimaldi's is fantastic if you ask me.   Also during this time, Bianco made national headlines as the "Best Pizza in America." Over and over and over. For my part, I did NOT care - wild horses could not have dragged me back to Bianco after my original experience there.  Recently though, I was shocked to realize that Bianco had opened up a second location near me! And it wasn't busy! I made a mental note to myself, and the following weekend the wife and I went for a visit. After all I have been through I know a lot more, I'm more prepared to love this pizza, and I don't have to deal with the ridiculous wait! Fantastic!  What a shame to have to report that the experience failed on every single possible level.   We arrived for a late lunch at about 1:30 on a Sunday figuring we would be past whatever rush might exist. It seemed we were right. There was one table with two very noisy people seated at it. Naturally, we were seated immediately next to them in this otherwise empty space. Mere minutes later, a family came in with three screaming children, who were promptly seated next to us on our other side. Because of the screaming kids, I could no longer quite make out the other table's noisy conversation! An excellent start!  The menu is sparse. Most restaurants do overkill. Bianco does the opposite of overkill. Four pizzas (five?) and if you don't like those, there are half a dozen toppings that you can add - or can you build your own? It wasn't clear. Appetizers? None of that. I asked the waitress if all they offered in the way of appetizers were the three salads on the menu, and she attempted to explain to me how the salads were in fact appetizers. Yeah, I already said that. But that wasn't the question. So three salads, five pizzas. I think a few pastas, but who wants pasta with pizza?  While we waited, we were brought some crusty bread and olive oil, the bread was too crusty and the olive oil could have seriously used some balsamic to go with it - but we were glad to have something to nibble on while we waited for everyone else in the restaurant to get drinks before we were even asked if we wanted any. When we did get our drinks, they came in cans, with dental office sized drinking glasses filled with ice. Just like being on an airplane! Genius!  We were (eventually) asked what we would like to order. We opted for the Sonny Boy (there is only one size pizza, naturally) and something called "simple local greens" or something similarly pompous. We received them both at the exact same time (so much for that appetizer theory!) and we were equally unimpressed by both. The salad consisted entirely of chewy, bitter greens dressed meagerly with olive oil and vinegar. Seriously dry. I love salads. I could barely choke this down and it went largely uneaten. Seriously, my wife will tell you. I'll murder an entire salad plate. Not this one.  But the pizza! The glorious, "Best in America" pizza! Right? This has to be a joke. Am I being punked? Unsubstantial, salty to a fault and completely forgettable. It was more like eating a cracker with pizza toppings than an actual pizza. The tomato sauce was good - just tomatoes really, very simple - which is OK with me. But every other aspect of this pizza was a complete and utter failure. No such thing as too thin? Wrong. This pizza was hardly there. This ain't a Neopolitan thing. This is just stingy. And it's not good! No chew to it at all. Very little in the way of cheese but both the sopresatta and olives were way too salty in any case.   I wish this could have gone way differently. I wanted to believe. But there is a lot of good pizza in Phoenix now and wait or no wait, there is no need to try and find it here. This place has a lot of name cache - but that's it. I have no idea how it has sustained this level of interest for this long. The menu is weird, the food is barely mediocre and the staff do not seem to have adequate training.  What I can say is that despite their obliviousness in seating us, the waitstaff at this location were at least pleasant. I could not say that about the experience at the original location I had years ago, so that at least is a step up.

xtzSuJIB4WOx6cy7trR48A.text: Always a great dinner experience at Bianco.  Its great to see that they opened the place at town and country.  You can actually get in and seated during the week, which is a nice change from his original place downtown.  Pizza is spectacular as always and now he offers other dishes, which i haven't tried yet.  Great atmosphere, service and prices.  Could go head to head with any pizzeria in Brooklyn!

7Zeky3hV8kkMgwBHgYcd9A.text: Best Pizza Ever, Hands Down  I had some shopping to do at Town & Country Plaza, but hadn't had a thing to eat all day. I saw the sign for Pizzeria Bianco and decided to see if they were too busy to accommodate me. (I had heard that there was always a line to get in.)  Well, it was apparently my lucky day. When I entered the restaurant, I was promptly shown to a nice seat at the bar and provided with ice water and a lunch menu.   The menu wasn't large, and my eye immediately focused on the pizza selections. There were 6 pizza offerings, 3 with red sauce, and 3 without. I wanted something straightforward, so I settled on the pizza margherita (tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, and basil) and asked them to add garlic. I was assured that the crust would be thin and crisp. I also ordered a glass of the house red wine, and settled in to wait.  While I was waiting, the couple next to me generously offered to share their pizza with me since they had more than they could eat. I let them know I appreciated the offer, but that I was reserving my appetite to be able to finish my own pizza.   It came out moments later, and looked perfect. Biting into my first slice was even better. The crust was super thin, crisp, and tasty. This was not going to be one of those pizzas where part of the crust would be left on the plate. Every bit of each slice demanded to be eaten. the tomato sauce was just acidic enough, and married well with the fresh mozzarella, basil, garlic and the crust. Each mouthful was light and delightful. There was nothing heavy at all about my pizza. I was glad that I had kept it simple rather than ordering a pizza heavy with ingredients.   Pizza devoured, I became curious about the dessert offerings. I hadn't seen any on the menu, and so had to quiz my server about the possibilities. I settled on a pear tart, garnished with a dip of nutmeg Italian ice. The pear tart was nice, but the nutmeg Italian ice was out of this world. Yum!!! It almost tasted perfumed with the nutmeg, and slightly custardy. I didn't even need the pear tart.  I have to go back again for the pizza, but I don't intend to leave without having the nutmeg Italian ice again. My entire lunch was such a treat. This is now at the top of my list for best pizza.   The service, while very friendly, was a little spotty. I wasn't sure at several points, who was supposed to be taking care of me, and about the time I finished my pizza, everyone disappeared. I had to solicit someone to discuss dessert, and again, to pay my check. I enjoyed my meal so much that I really didn't mind too much.  ------------------------------------------------Second Visit 9/8/15------------------------------- OK, I am now still a fan of the pizza, but NOT a fan of the service.  It was worse than spotty this time.  I was able to place my order, but then there was apparently a shift change.  Someone did bring me the piping hot pizza I had ordered - and it was perfect again - but then no check back to see how it was, no service period until someone finally noticed my plate pushed away and came to take it around 10 minutes after I had finished.  It wasn't busy, there were all kinds of staff standing around across the room talking to each other.  I stand by the pizza, but the service was so poor that I cut way back on my tip.

osDxqbr_bs3m_YL0Ynxbrg.text: Love the atmosphere! Wait staff was nice and very attentive. Pizza is decent but not really sure if it is worth the price. Would go if friends suggested it but would be my first choice.

r4cQCJpzEb3EMMlwQ71zoQ.text: Unlike the 623 E Adams St location this place gets an extra star for taking reservations. Having the Wiseguy pizza here did not bring back the memory of the other location's greatness. Service was quick and friendly and they took us right on time for our reservation, which were also pluses yet...another downside was the acoustics of the room we were seated in. It was a large room and I do not think it was the people in it but something about the hard surfaces or shape made it one of the loudest dining experiences I have had in a long time. It was actually hard to have a conversation with the people sitting across from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Wiseguy

FS26wDXWyOMQBB6p9qy_7A.text: Visit 2, this time for dinner:  Crostini with Garlic Goat's milk Butter  Pasta e Fagioli - Native Seed Search Beans, House Made Orchiette  Cheese Plate with candied nuts, fig orange marmalade, Pear- Red Barn Cheddar, Gorgonzola, 'Goat' Cheese  Roasted Beets with Wild Greens, Warm Goat Cheese, Champagne Vinaigrette, Pistachio  House Bread with Pac Sun Olive Oil  AZ Sonoran White Wheat Crespelle with Escarole, Homemade Ricotta, Tomato Sauce  Faella Spaghetti with Bianco Dinapoli Tomato, Basil  Crispy Potato Gnocchi with Brown Butter, Sage, Parmesean Reggiano  Apple Crostata with Crema  Rice Pudding with Orange Fig Marmalade  Having since rebranded the restaurant to Trattoria Bianco after installing a stone oven to make his legendary pies the first meal I enjoyed with my family after driving back from Las Vegas was at Italian Restaurant.  Having already visited the Pizzeria, Pane, and Italian Restaurant for lunch myself this was my first dinner at a Bianco restaurant and arriving to find the space bustling we opted to sit outdoors in order to avoid the noise; a big mistake that instead led to both captain and a server named Adam largely ignoring us throughout the evening as water went unfilled, dishes were dropped off without description, ingredient questions required further investigation with the kitchen, and epic delays occurred between each course, plate pickup, and particularly drop-off and collection of desserts along with the check.  Moving past service issues, the food was every bit as good as the first visit, the housemade pastas and bread clearly a strong point while fresh local produce shined in a salad with bright, bold vinaigrette and beets sweeter than almost any I'd previously encountered.  Unfortunately replacing my all-time favorite corn and pancetta gnocchi with a slightly more seasonal version featuring brown butter and sage the dumplings themselves once again melted in the mouth while the crespelle, a crepe stuffed to bursting with creamy cheese and bitter escarole, topped with Bianco's signature sauce was rustic, simple, and  perfect - just the way Italian food should be and just the way Chris and his team make it at each of their restaurants.

RDc16MdJ0z6UhM4Cjtlz7w.text: First and last time here. Waited about an hour while we had drinks at Grassroots (which was a really nice place with a good menu...should have ordered there!)  Bianca had a very sparse menu, but with all the hype we thought we would give it a try. Big mistake. I was surprised that the inside looked a little dingy. And, very loud.   Wanted an appetizer like calamari but was told they had no seafood products.  The waiter was very busy but did a good job checking on us and running around. I really was hoping for a good pizza and ordered the margarita pizza with fennel sausage and a beer. My wife ordered Pappardelle an a glass of wine.   The waiter brought us bread and a saucer of what was supposed to be melted butter?  Someone must have taken all the flavor from it before it got to us. $7 Beer was tasty though. $14 glass of wine was good too.   The Pappardelle (about two cups of overly done mushy noodles and a meat sauce) was well under par for an $18 entree dish. No salad.   Pizza... I was expecting 12" of something special for $20. Looked like the cook was blindfolded when he made it or maybe shook it around before serving it.  If you like super thin cracker crust with very little on it, then this is for you.   So, we ate very little and stopped back at Grassroots.  Took the Bianca leftovers to my mother in law ;  )

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No so special.

xqqRIHzTEU4oDnyX3IundQ.text: We were on a hunt for the best pizza in town. My father-in-law lives here with his wife, & we are all foodies. The pizza here was delish, but I actually think the pasta is where it's at. I had the best lasagna of my life here - it was so good, it inspired me to make homemade lasagna at home - all from scratch, even the cheese. I found the pizza to be tasty, & definitely satisfying, but the dough wasn't as flavorful as others, and the sauce didn't give me that warm sweet feeling. But it was definitely good. But my advice, if you go here, get the entrees, pastas, and appetizers. Plus, they have a legit italian cherry soda. Oh, and their chocolate cake, and creme brulee was outstanding!

iaZIpdPtiLA3HEdVYUdr3w.text: Delicious and authentic. Having lived in the Amalfi Coast (Southern Italy near Naples and famous for the best Pizza even within Italy), I am a snob when it comes to pizza. I had been told about Pizzeria Bianco, but was a little skeptical. As soon as I tried the bread, I knew they would get it right. Excellent naturally-thin crust (very important), not too much toppings, and high quality good ingredients. The location in not great (not a lot of ambiance), but it is simple and the service was good. I would defo go back. Oh, get the homemade mozzarella dish if you like the preparation. Ours was a classic caprese and it was amazing.

lFeaVhlsfR67WfG_MfkGjQ.text: Amazing food and good wine selection. We have been here several times.  We usually go to the Heritage Square location (we like the ambiance there better) but this time we had a party of 12 for a 50th Birthday celebration. They took excellent care of us. We will back soon.

BmUbmj_6K8Sblq-ICFfAfg.text: Nothing special. Had better and worse brick oven pizza.  It was middle of the road. Service was good. Price point was acceptable.  Not memorable.

HKEUREP2c8DcH50wIVmVSA.text: Best birthday present ever!! I had my favorite pizza on my birthday at pizzeria bianco. It's so delicious and amazing service.  Couldn't have made my day better being here.  Yummm

vBXlZLDV3AFi1EhgPDUpBQ.text: For my 100th review, I'd figure to write a review on a establishment that Phoenix is known for, and visitors from out of state would ask me....Is Pizzeria Bianco really the best pizza in the US?  For that question, I can not truly say YES or NO, but if you enjoy pizza, this place is worth a try.  For me, I think the simplicity of the pizza and the quality of the ingredients really shined through!  The tomato and mozzarella was fresh and crisp, the pizza was thin and crispy, yet had that nice chew you get from pizza that has great dough!  The sauce had a hint of sweetness and the basil on the margarita was fresh and delicious.  We ordered several pizzas to share and some salads to go along.  Overall, I was pretty impressed, we had a reservation so we didn't wait very long.  I'm not quite sure if its worth a 2 hour wait though.  I see reviews where people waited that long at times.  I would definitely come back for this pizza.  Little pricey, but nice ambiance and they have a bar next door if you want to get a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Kx-NsOCMx3WdPziWMS9aaA.text: Are you looking for fresh ingredients and great atmosphere? Well this is your place. I was in Phoenix for a week and ate here twice. The first night I had pizza which was one of the best I can remember ever eating. Even the leftovers were great. For dessert I had the flourless chocolate cake. It was pure chocolate heaven.  I decided to go back for pasta another night and again I was very pleased. Oh and I had another piece of the flourless chocolate cake. I was only there for a week so I had to indulge a little.  Highly recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flourless Chocolate Cake
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza

8rBwDPA9breTRLids_7v9g.text: First to review!  I had to say it.  Everyone and their mom knows about this place.  Did you know there is now a 2nd location?  This one just recently opened its doors.  I gotta say, if you haven't been able to get downtown to try this place out yet I would definitely check out this location.  We were seated immediately (on a Tuesday night).  When we left there was a line but regardless it is much less busy than the downtown location.  This location also takes reservations!  Keep that in mind for those busy Friday and Saturday nights.  Alright, lets get down to the pizza.  I had the Wiseguy.  I always have the wiseguy.  It has a delicious smoky flavor to it that you cant get anywhere else.  I have tried about 3 of the pizzas here and have not had a bad one yet.  The prices are a little high (as in $18 for a personal pizza), but whats wrong with splurging every once in a while?  That being said, I have to compare this place to some of my other favorite spots in the area.  The other two juggernauts, The Parlor and LGO, are right around the corner.  The Parlor is still my #1 pizza joint around here.  You can't beat their meat & cheese plates.  I would say LGO and Bianco are tied for #2.  LGO has a great vibe and neighborhood location.  Also its closer to my house.    You need to try all 3 places and judge for yourself.  They are now all relatively close to each other and are by far the best 3 pizza joints in Phoenix.  Its the only way to truly know!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CBK5qjcS1XjFvC2vg8fDWQ.text: Their fresh pasta and pizza is hard to beat. Good wine list, friendly staff. I love the authentic Italian seating and decor. A+

HIwpq7IzzvcdXuZM94hLkw.text: There are limited choices of pizza that are available. The crust was a little bit more on the burned side. The flavor of the margarita was average. On top of all that the service was not that great. Our waiter came and checked ok once after we received our food.

RN3WYcl1tBzcjqXqS42-mA.text: Amazing thin crust pizza, the  Sonny Boy pizza is amazing, we added mushrooms and they were flavorful. Great service too!

BotXsCpcJjxVcMXmNYTUSQ.text: These guys are doing it right. Staff is great, food is great. Highly recommend you stop here.  Had the Sonny Boy and the Wiseguy.  Sauced perfectly, moz was just amazing. Smoked onions, oh my god. The soprasetta was fantastic and the fennel sausage to die for... and the olives. Just beautiful.  The bread and olive oil. I cant say enough.  It is expensive if you are normally eating garbage and expect a 16 inch pie for 8.50. These guys are using really good stuff so dont complain about the price, just shut up and eat.  Down side is that when I was there the place was over run with hipsters but what can you do.

rmUbL0MAnrCEU5X5AXY7eg.text: Dear Pizza Bianco  Where have you been all my life???? I've always been to the one down town. This is so much bettter. Yummmmm.  Your favorite customer
