dpS7P9GiW8uGtqebf48a-g.text: I rarely write reviews but I have now eaten at Italian Restaurant a few times and, after reviewing some of the other Yelpers opinions, I felt like I had to write this because this place is great and deserves kudos. Wow, some of you yelpers are so picky about things that have so little to do with what a Chris Biano restaurant is known for- the food!  Every dish I have ordered so far has been delicious and satisfying. You can taste the freshness and quality in everything you order at Italian Restaurant. The talent in the kitchen is apparent in the complex flavors found in some of the simpler items found here such as the amazing cornmeal laden bread and the perfect meatballs. The portions are just right- just enough to satsify without sending you out the door overstuffed.  The dining is quaint and shabby chic. Some of the other reviewers have complained about the small chairs and tables or the large family style seating but to them I say- have you never been to a Chris Bianco restaurant before? If so you should already know what to expect. If you don't like it then don't go! The rest of us who know that you go to a Chris Bianco restaurant to enjoy the food will be happy to fill your empty spots.   I am giving Italian Restaurant four stars for now because I think that they have a few new restaurant kinks to work out but have no doubt that once they get things running smoothly 5 stars will be my permanent rating. I will definitely be back- often!

1GMFmVbYwGcEarT8JfRdsg.text: Incredible!  Best pizza anywhere.  Amazingly fresh salads also.  Great ambiance and service.  Better than the original location, only wish they had a location in north Scottsdale

fc0uNjmuATjv9XJWSY2vNQ.text: Extraordinary pizza. Fresh flavors. Lightning fast service. Helpful. And the pizza: seriously good. Ambiance a bit loud for me but for most folks just fine.

831yudB4x3d1xA0-O3Xc7g.text: Given our tiny waistlines and the generally enormous servings at Italian restaurants, my two friends and I elected to split a pasta entree (butternut squash ravioli), an appetizer (a hard cheese and sour cherries dish) and bread.  Well, maybe that wasn't the best idea.  Portions here are much, much smaller than you'd expect.    The food was definitely high quality but, honestly, nothing to rave about.  The pasta was flavorless and the "special sour cherries" in the appetizer just tasted like cherry pie filling.  The bread was top notch though, especially dipped in the sauce from the pasta.    The place has a lovely, warm ambiance and the open kitchen is awesome.  I would have loved to sit on their beautiful patio, but it wasn't open yet.  Service was impeccable and should be noted.    I would maybe come back for bread and wine.  I was just a little disappointed in the main event.

BUEM3hrSUGMg7nrWaeDqlA.text: The concept of a small, intimate, italian restaurant is realized. I've gone about 5 times now and every time it gets better.  Meatballs and Polenta are to die for.  The Pasta and Anchovy sauce was crazy ridiculous.

-egZBsrOAyX4_vX3hINULA.text: Flavorful fresh ingredients! I came here on a double date after wanting to try it for a while. We started off with the grilled zucchini appetizer, I would come back for this alone! It was very well done, the combination of fried egg, lemon, mint and cheese was amazing, it worked really well together. I had the eggplant strozzapreti and my husband had the gnocchi, they portion size was large and the pasta was fresh and full of well put together flavors. We asked the server for a recommendation on wine as we like lighter reds and she suggested the pinot nero which was very good. Service was attentive as well. I will definitely come back here as now I want to try everything on the menu!

PcH6sXVA4yrTLCYEDGBm3w.text: All the hype Ive heard living in Phoenix all my life and finally my wife and I went to try it. It's fine pizza. Candle lit meal; and pizza. Complex menu; but they call it pizza.   Tasted fine but I just don't think it's for me and certainly not the best pizza in the US- not even in PHX.

FXNJ8OZ0F2mBdfeDk91hzw.text: THIS WAS AWSUM !!! Got an order to go a Margherita pizza and a fresh mozzarella and tomato sandwich. Both delightful. When I am in Arizona I plan on going back with my brother and sister-in-law for a sit down dinner.

B3QHQXM0h6zQwiw_k0MCHQ.text: Went here for Mother's Day weekend last year, and it was me, my mom, my brother, my aunt and uncle, and my grandma. Ordered 4 pizzas between all of us and they were all delicious. And the inside of the restaurant is so beautiful! Yet another place I miss when I'm not in Arizona.

YVfdrkvUaskm__vknT92gw.text: The hype of being one of the best pizzerias in the U.S. is tough to live up to. In my multiple experiences of visiting this location and the original one downtown, I have no reason to doubt it. For my money, it's certainly the best pizza I've had.   I've tried all the pizzas on the menu and the two that I recommend most are the Margarita and Wiseguy. Both having different appeal, the Margarita is superb. The tomato sauce is fresh, juicy, and not too sweet. The mozzarella cheese is easily the best I've ever had on a pizza - smooth, firm, and properly salted, it is a wonder on its own merit. Finally, there's the crust, crisp and bubbled on the outside and soft and airy on the inside. Combine the three elements together with fresh basil leaves on top and for me, it's the best pizza there is.  As for the Wiseguy, any meat lovers will adore this masterpiece. A white pizza, this one features fennel sausage and roasted onions along with the aforementioned mozzarella. Both the sausage and onion carry a smoky flavor that is enhanced by the smooth creaminess of the mozzarella. This applies to both pizzas but I highly recommend adding garlic to the pizza for an added flavor dimension.   Overall, this is easily the best pizza in Arizona, with apologies to Pomo, Cibo, and Federal. As for the best in the country, perhaps that's a better question for someone with extensive experience. For me though, I see no reason to doubt the claim.

fnf_Fzy0E4wGGf8C3_ptZQ.text: Went in open minded and everything we had was good: - Handmade mozzarella salad - Pizzas Rosa, Biancoverde, Wiseman, and Margherite - A glass of Dos Cabesas red blend - Orange citrus ice - Flourless chocolate cake We go back for all or any of these again. Have some bianco, and have a great day.

b5L2QKDQ4gXkRqClbNkuwQ.text: My friend and I were hungry for pizza, and Pizzeria Bianco seemed like the perfect place to go. Our server was great. The pizzas, however, were such a disappointment. Pizzeria Bianco is legendary for great pizzas, I don't know what happened. I ordered the Margherita, and sadly, there was hardly any sauce on it, there was less cheese than I expected. It was so dry, probably the worst pizza I've ever had. I thought it must be my imagination, because everyone loves their pizza. Since I love cold pizza, I saved half, and thought the next day I would realize how great it was. I didn't even see sauce on it. Dry and flavorless. My friend ordered the Sonny Boy, and didn't enjoy his either. Maybe it was an off night for the chef, I don't know, but I won't go again.

nyeEe5XmWpPg0XIxjlyiHQ.text: Overestimated place...not the best pizza at all!! Nothing special about it. And what made it even worse there's no free parking and their valet literally asked for tips (plus $5 just for parking) which make this a disappointing experience for me.

yZlsHflI7yTNk77ED4YcfQ.text: Seriously what is wrong with people?? This is some of the best pizza in AZ, hands down. Amazing ingredients and top notch service. Not sure how people can give this place anything less than five stars. Some people have no idea what great food is because this place definitely has amazing food!!!

wqgiwHhuVY9Cdm2TjU6_3A.text: Some of the best/freshest Italian food I've ever had. Every bite was scrumptious. I appreciated that the menu was simple and straightforward, not too many choices but just enough to have options. My mom got the pappardelle which had the perfect blend of flavors and melt-in-your-mouth freshly made pasta. I had the Sonny Boy pizza and I really appreciated the fresh mozzarella - it was the perfect amount and really refreshing. Our food also came out quickly; they literally just whipped it up and sent it out. Can't wait to go back!

nV28FLgumwP6ATBBaTsj2A.text: The service was wonderful and the pizza and appetizer were great, the wine however, was awful. Bought a bottle and had it brought to the table, I wish we could have tasted it before we had to commit.

oBv7S6C5CJRsNM1foJwmxw.text: I flew from NJ to AZ for business and my collegue and I couldnt wait to try Pizzeria Bianco! Considering they received an award deeming them one of the best pizzerias in the nation, we just had to try it. A few other colleagues hyped this place up as well. So we came. And almost missed our flight back home... The pizzas were good. But I've had better pizza's in California, Jersey and NYC. So not sure what deemed it best in the nation.

WDGs8acw4N3gvmOT-HMMxA.text: *Fresh* *Authentic* *Friendly*  Came here on a whim having few expectations, as my favorite Italian place is up north a bit, BUT was very surprised as everything was amazing. From the simple greens, to the Margherita, WiseGuy, flourless chocolate cake and the rice pudding with rhubarb compot on top. Even with 3 small children the service was friendly and prompt with their pasta before our dishes, alleviating the whining and fidgeting for a brief time. Great ambiance is perfect for a date night as well.  Would recommend putting a couple Oregon Pinots on the wine list; showcasing the more appropriate northern varietals would set you apart from every place that defaults to California grapes.  Recommend dropping someone off to check in before parking (next to a TJ's...lot always full).

LQ5Sxa6Sgia-dSYhdX5uJQ.text: I was so disappointed by our experience at this restaurant. I've wanted to try Pizzeria Bianco for a long time - it is on a national list of best pizza places in the country, and it's in my city. Plus they serve my favorite style of pizza, so we should have been in for a treat.  It started before we even got to see a menu. We walked in on a Monday night and there were various open tables in the front room, we couldn't see in the back. There was one 2-top open and two 4-tops. I asked if we could have a 4-top because we like to sit next to each other when we go out, and it was our anniversary. The hostess then went on a rant about how she has to seat us at a table for two in case bigger parties come in, so that she can have the other tables open, but since we are the customer she has to seat us where we want, yada yada... I was a hostess for years, I know how that works, but I've never actually told a customer all of that because in my opinion the right answer is always "yes," unless you actually have reservations for bigger parties and you have to save those tables. So after huffing and puffing, she sat us at the worst of all of the tables, right in front of the door and the kitchen, so there was a ton of traffic going past us all night and the door was opening and shutting, blowing cold air on us. This really bothered me because the other two tables were beautiful, quiet, and the other 4-top was more secluded near a window. Our view was of the front door, which is not really where I want to be looking when I am enjoying an anniversary date. Our table was just awkward and I felt so uncomfortable with the other (better) open tables around us.   Throughout our meal the hostess proceeded to seat parties of two at the other tables...  Our server came and took our order, and brought us bread and oil. I know some reviewers complained about the oil and bread being bland, but I actually enjoyed the delicate flavors of the oil.  We ordered two pizzas and our server seemed disappointed that we didn't order more.   The pizzas left something to be desired. They were really under seasoned and tasteless. We ordered the Wise Guy and the Margherita pizzas. The Margherita is my favorite kind of pizza, and the pizza I use to judge most restaurants. The basil was fresh but the flavor of the tomato sauce was really lacking the level of freshness and robust flavor of other restaurants. The Wise Guy really needed salt. Usually with this type of pizza I can eat most of one by myself because of the thin crust, but I barely finished 3 pieces.  Our server never came to check on us.   The only good thing I can say is at least the Margherita tasted better as cold leftovers.

kvvy8qVv2WVCY92MkgitOQ.text: This place is, hands down, the best pizza place in AZ!  Love this location - always able to get in without the 4 hour wait @yhe downtown location.  Gorgeous vintage Italian trattoria decor makes you feel at home  Our faves are the Sonny Boy for a red sauced pie and the Wise Guy for a white one.    Farm fresh ingredients & perfectly wood fired make the pizzas & salads so special

jnWSR7oBkVTWVEuTrrAmwQ.text: Good Italian flavors and crispy oven brick pizza. Cute outdoor eating area with candle on the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta Dish
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy thin oven pizza
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Complimentary bread and oil

xO711jVM-fYG5TuVAR7MsQ.text: Good overall pizza. Not the best I've ever had. Portions are on the small side, and a little pricey for what you get.  Toppings included prosciutto and onions.  Service was decent.   I'd go again.

NCi0hTXXMrRttrbZxdt9GA.text: What do you do on a trip from the east coast passing through Phoenix ? Taste the best Napoetana in AZ and see if it stands up to the test. The location doesn't lend a whole lot to the ambiance but the interiors and outdoor seating are pretty good.What matters the most though, the pie and the wine selection. Decent mix of local and international full bodied wines. The test has to be based on a margherita and a white pie for which I pick the Wiseguy (it has pistachios). Also threw in a gnocchi for good measure since was with an equally hungry friend. The margherita thin, crispy and flavorful. The wise one with pistachios equally good. The unexpected winner was the creamy and home made fresh potato pasta gnocchi.   Bianco not only lived up to NYC standards, might even beaten a few good ones in Brooklyn. Enough said, a bit pricey but definitely deserves a stop on a good night for locals and tourists alike !

EnR_-ben2R7kH8a2lMxwhQ.text: Pizza and lasagna are the way to go. Find out what the market special is too. Must stop if you're in Phoenix, and you like Italian food

BlXklwS57CSOrUwfuy5jDw.text: Homemade & authentic   After enjoying the downtown pizzeria bianco I was happy to hear of the location in town & country.  My mom and I met here for dinner on a week night.  We did not have a reservation but there was no wait.  This bianco has 2 main dining areas decorated in a modern shabby chic style that feels home, vintage and elegant.    We shared a bottle of Lambrusco which was delicious.  For dinner we shared a wise guy pizza ($18-amazing) and the gnocchi w summer corn which was only ok.  The wise guy was a salty Caramelized yummy dream atop chewy homemade authentic pizza dough.  Love it always.  The gnocchi was a tad more firm almost crunchy, which is not how most gnocchi is served.  The pancetta bits were a little chewy and not crispy like I was hoping for.  The Arizona sweet corn was basically a drier creamed corn underneath the pasta.  I took a pizza home for my hunny- half wise guy & half rosa.  The rosa was nice & tangy with the light crunch of pistachios yum!  Our server was timely & obviously loved the food here.  We took our time with dinner & enjoyed ourselves.  Since we visited weeks ago I have a longing to return...  Only downside was dinner for 2 and 1 to go pizza was over $150!  Do not come here to get a deal that's for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. To go pizza &amp; cappuccino
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Window to kitchen

c11tbsRHxdj9xmvBdwsACA.text: I have been to Pizzeria Bianco once before with two friends, but this last time? It was something so special and Pizzeria Bianco made it something to remember. It was my 26th birthday back on January 18th, and my boyfriend had "told" me we were coming here for dinner, just the two of us and had planned a little menu for us and already ordered my favorite wine (Lioco Chardonnay). This did fool me because I assumed that this Restaurant would be a great place to put personal touches to a special night, such as a select menu for two. WELL?   I walked into the restaurant with my boyfriend and was escorted to the back room by the hostess, turned and there was a table, 20 people full, all of my family, friends, my boyfriends family, and a restaurant to cheer them along when they yelled "Surprise" and "Happy Birthday". Pizzeria Bianco had already been taking care of them with antipasti, wine and beer. Once I sat down after the tears of surprise/joy and hugs, the food started to come out, perfectly cooked! This was all done family style too.   To Start: Antipasti, local greens, Spiedini (wood fire skewers of prosciutto wrapped fontina) Dinner: Grilled Basil Chicken, Roasted pork shoulder Pizzas: Wiseguy, Rosa, Margherita   Sides: Risotto, Vegetarian Lasgna   We ended with a Cake from Barbs Bakery that Pizzeria Bianco was kind enough to keep in the back and slice after they presented it to me, candles and all. We finished our meal with smooth espressos and cappuccinos.   THANK YOU Pizzeria Bianco, your restaurant is so well run, quaint, and with some of the best food in town. You threw the best birthday for such a large party and never once skipped a beat. I could of not been surprised with a better birthday dinner location than this.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Surprise birthday cake
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner Setting

k6iTWkjzn1xDvNtlAu0Gdw.text: All I have to say really is just WOW! What a difference this location is from the Adams st location.  My family brought me here for father's day and as far as bad experiences go, this was the Mack Daddy.    I normally don't complain about having too much topping on a pizza but the amount of Soppresata salami they put on our pizza was criminal, making it so greasy and soggy even my pizza loving son could not eat it.  Strangely enough, the salami tasted stale and the crust was burnt far more than the desirable amount.  Our server was a ghost after taking our order, more concerned with re-stocking the bar than checking in on us.  I am extremely disappointed as I held chef Bianco in such high regard, but after this experience I may need to think carefully before recommending his establishments to anyone else.

A_Ff85goxdrEo4F6qSAjKQ.text: Took my mom and brother and sister in law here - they were skeptical but were quickly won over by the great food - thanks

DU5RJ8bvEm_4OIeTpp1d4Q.text: I think this spot was too hyped for me. Yes, it is delicious pizza and yes, I was very intrigued by the rosemary pistachio option (which we got), but I didn't think it was drastically better than some of the best pizza places I've had elsewhere in the country.   I read a lot about parking and it seems like everyone had concerns with the downtown location. This one is connected to a shopping plaza so it was very easy to park and not worry about that aspect.

IknpDK66i-C0onhPYgVniQ.text: If someone asks me what I want for my last meal.....it would be the Rosa pizza! Brick oven crispy.....read onions, the sharp cheese and....pistachios!!!  What a brilliant combination!! Even the smell of burnt wood on every piece is amazing. If you have any senses left...and you love food, Try this pizza and tell me it's not at least delicious!! Thanks Chris Bianco! M

MhCl1aOu1XooRw934Z66IQ.text: Until now I've struggled to find brick over pizza that compares to back home on the east coast. Chris Bianco is well deserving of his pizza god status.

m7suExEKcebLl93TK-3fXg.text: I have wanted to return for years at the downtown Phoenix location but was intimidated by the reported waiting time. I arrived to this location at 6:45 and was seated within 15 minutes!  Bonus! We started with the spring greens salad-it was quite generous with a light vinaigrette dressing. A nice lead in to pizza.  I had the margarita pizza. I ordered extra cheese, extra sauce, extra crispy. It came with areas of slight burn that I love. A great marinara and high quality rich cheese. This is one of the best pizzas in the Phoenix metropolitan area.  Service was friendly and attentive.  We had a wonderful meal-highly recommended.

dfrA8jQ8yuDJIn6g_hO1XA.text: Yummy Yummy Yummy Yummy Yummy Yummy  AS GOOD AS IT GETS Take out or eat in Try the Rosa!  I also add prosciutto to the arugula cheese pizza.

aFpn2CTbb3m8Xc8f25zdEQ.text: Originally we were planning to eat somewhere else but as we were leaving my Sisters closet we saw this place. My friend had been before.. I thought it looked familiar but wasn't positive if it was the same place in The District in LV. Staff is all extremely friendly... I went in just to look at the menu to try to decide on dinner. Our hotel was across the street but we had a very busy day so we wanted a nice meal. Aa we are looking over the menu and chatting with hostess and the super friendly tall women, we decided this was definitely the place for us. My only complaint at this point and for the rest of the meal is that the menu has this amazing salad listed as small plates... Which is super confusing because all the items listed actually all come together in an amazing salad. Thankfully while I was reading it over - it didn't make sense to me that goat cheese would be served by itself, small plate or not, so I asked what it came with and they explained it was all one amazing salad. That completly sealed the deal for me deciding to eat here. We ordered the salad and a pizza and both were amazing Highly recommend this place if you are in the area.. Or if not.. Make the drive - there enough amazing things in this area to make it worth !

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The &#34;Small Plates&#34; is actually one amazing salad. Highly recommend

IN7vbFBDeniSMvvaUX5HSQ.text: This authentic Italian restaurant is so delicious and has amazing customer service.  The oven baked pizzas are perfected and the mouth watering mozzarella takes you back to Sorrento! The pappardelle is tasty too, the sauce is super flavorful! Thank you, Pizzeria Bianco!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappardelle Pasta and Sonny Boy pizza

d0w5stR9XIAF4Ju4X5uPiw.text: We were surprised that it lived up to the hype. Great space, wonderful smell in the air (oak and pecan wood cooking your pies), absolutely top-notch service and flavors that have us dreaming of a quick return. We got the Wiseguy and the pappardelle with ragu, and we were pretty amazed with the flavors and textures of both. Only thing was that the Wiseguy was a little soggy in the middle, but that's a style thing and it's also got to do with the piles of fennel and onion on this sausage/smoked mozzarella pie. Wow, was it good, though! The pappardelle was actually al dente (Who goes to a pizza place to get pasta? - it's worth doing here!) and appeared housemade. The ragu was fantastic. The servers brought us great olives (we turned down the bread, as we weren't starving) and chile oil and flakes, as well as water, beer (go for the IPA - the one I had was solidly good) and wine.   And then we ran into Chef on the way out the door. Cool!  Anyway, I'd go back tomorrow . . . too bad it'll have to wait until the next time we're in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wiseguy
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappardelle

DmnTVFL7pCULRPp1ijlm1Q.text: I have been to Italy, New York and Chicago and this is the best pizza outside of Italy. Every time I go doesn't matter in which location I feel like I'm in pizza heaven. The atmosphere is really cool, feels like a country barn house. Waiters are excellent and give you just the right amount of space.   Now for the food OMG everything is amazing, such fresh flavors and simple. The crust on the pizza is super thin with just the right amount of sauce, cheese and toppings. Every bite is perfection!    I love this pizza if you don't know already!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All I have to say is Sonny Boy Pizza!!!!!!
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I love there fresh Handmade Mozzarella and depending on season you get tomatoes or peppers, both are worth it. The bread and olive oil YUM
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_kYBX6ISHLs34kSDQ65wMg.text: We were recommended by a local while waiting in line at Lil Miss BBQ .. Nice place for lunch for a Nice NY Pizza with fresh ingredients.. Tys crust was thin, crisp and airy with tons of Fresh flavors. We had a Local mix salad that was super fresh.. We would definitely come back here on our next visit..

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garden fresh local salad
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh bread
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. SonnyBoy Pizza

Zvsnml4pwwXfnFhI-YHcyQ.text: Food and service were excellent. Decor is very fun. The prosciutto wrap was delicious over the arugula and the pozza crust and sauce were just what I was looking for.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back dining room.

LpX3MP-oCYK-AJZmqcUqAQ.text: Bobby Flay recommended this place and this I had high expectations going on.  It lived up to it.  I recommend the mozzarella and tomato salad and any pizza.

S2zxMD3AN57b2VyupAE_rQ.text: Now that's effing good pizza!   I have plenty more to say about Pizzeria Bianco but if you're one of the millions of people who don't read past the first sentence of anything, you get the gist.   Normally I'm not a fan of businesses who don't take reservations and have a huge line out the door. However, Bianco manages the high volume pretty well. Our party five arrived right at opening hours and were seated inside within  15 minutes. Had we opted for outside, it could've been even sooner.  Experiencing trendy pizza with parents can be questionable. They don't always understand why ingredients beyond pepperoni are added. Mine threw caution to the wind and let my husband and i order for the table. Not surprisingly, they loved the Margherita pizza the best. I liked the signature white pie crust. My husband loved it all.  It's upscale casual, like a lot of places in Scottsdale. Guests were on dates, with their kids, or like us in a mid-sized group. Service was hip but not snotty. It's pretty much my dream pizza joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tile bathroom floor

iWmh3MzKBZWOG-2vg5jFgQ.text: So this is my first time here. I never heard of this place and saw the sign by Trader Joe's. The restaurant is tiddy and cozy inside love the decor. So the food was good I shared it with my girlfriend who eats everything and she didn't even finish the pizza which is one of her favorites. We also ordered the spiedini, a mozzarella, tomato and basil appetizer and the margherita pizza. The spiedini was very good the appetizer was ok I expected it to be fresher it was kind of warm actually. The Margherita pizza is ok, it actually didn't have much flavor. The staff is very attentive and nice. This is a restaurant that I would maybe be willing to give it a second try in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita Pizza

s8DOnSFO9oJWgzLvSGDdgA.text: Pizzeria Bianco really surpassed my expectations.  I wasn't that jazzed initially when my husband showed me the menu - the toppings didn't seem that innovative, and the prices seemed....too much for pizza.  Little did I know the magic that must go on in the Pizzeria Bianco kitchen and oven.  We started with the fresh and warm bread that is served to each table - the crumb on the bread was airy and the olive oil it was served with was   We ordered a seasonal salad - arugula, candied pecans, ricotta salata, pears, and a light dressing.  Humble ingredients - dynamite when together.  I was very taken with the salad and we got an ample size for $10.  We split a pizza - it was enough for 2 if you ate all the bread provided (we did) and had an appetizer.  Otherwise, order a pizza each.  The pizza we ordered was the Sonny Boy (with olives only on half).  The salami on the pizza was very thinly sliced and nicely crisp from the wood-fired oven.  The cheese was perfectly melty.  Lastly, our service was fantastic.  We had one main waiter, but many people to tended to our table to ensure that our food came out quickly and that our glasses were never empty.  Top that all off with the right level of mood lighting (not so low that you strain to see, but low enough to be romantic) and we had a wonderful time.

RLgmpi8d4g5EPssxcHRDjg.text: Pizzeria Bianco is honestly the best pizza I've had in Arizona. I truly cannot believe I haven't tried it sooner, since I've been hearing over the years how great it is. Anyhow, I came here with a large group of family and friends, and we all just ordered family-style with several different pizzas, pastas, and appetizers to share.   I was not disappointed by a single thing we ordered, but the highlight of our dinner was the BiancoVerde pizza. The pastas were also delicious. I was able to try both the Lasagne and the Pappardelle, with the latter being my favorite of the two. The Pappardelle is served with a robust and flavorful meat bolognese sauce that is sure to please. Honestly, the quality of just about everything I tired was unparalleled to some similar places I've tried in the Valley.  The interior is also small and intimate, and makes you feel like you're eating dinner at home with family. Service was good and attentive for a large group, so no complaints there. PB definitely lived up to the hype I've heard! Overall, it was a great experience and we will all be sure to be back soon!

CEG31x1KxKtWpLbcXR0crA.text: Yessss! The pizza, the olives, the dessert. Service was great. I went for late dinner. The place was packed but there are so many people working there that you never were looking around for help.

mnYJUjSHHs7RHtoP0X_lEA.text: Meh. Nothing special, I think there a ton of other Neapolitan pizzas that live up to the hype. This pizza place was a bit bland with average service and average atmosphere.

aw12RUwJpOZcjWzdERjyEg.text: Came in with my best friend to have a slice. To my surprise they have personalized pizza and very traditional authentic Italian pizza. Our server was a guy named Richard. He was very efficient, quick & funny. His food knowledge is perfect. I'm reminded that life's always a little better with this as a great restaurant. This is a Phoenix must. And ask for Richard, to make your dinning experience wonderful.

Jaa1DuA4ZaJY0QSVycw7fQ.text: I agree - this was just ok.  Had the homemade mozz app w/arugula, which was very tasty, and better be for $15.  The farrut spaghetti was fresh but boring - needed something else (including salt & Parmesan).  Server didn't know if meatballs or any of the pastas had eggs, but found out for us.  We were never offered bread.  The twice-cooked vegetable soup was very good.  The side of garbanzos w/kale was also tasty.  While the food is good and the service is quick (if not a tad over-bearing), I think this place needs some tweaks.

HHGxz22z3cwt7HlYcgaz9Q.text: This place is delicious. Romantic yet comfortable atmosphere. Great service. Reasonable prices. Amazing food. I visited when it was the original "Italian Restaurant."  I like that they have expanded and now have a real bar! Absolutely recommend.

NyBPG7nYV_FoNlf8KGcaXw.text: We ended up at the Town & Country location after the downtown location had too long of a wait. It is just delish. We had the Sonny Boy, Wiseguy and Margherita enjoyed with Fourpeaks SunBru and Hop Knot. The pizza is great, especially the Wiseguy, caramelized onions, fennel sausage and smoked mozzarella - perfection. We ate outside on the patio, lovely. Waitstaff was attentive. Very nice experience.

_dAD6NQhTnBbNatuhEcq0A.text: Great gnocchi special recommended by our wonderful server. Others in our party had the lasagna, quite uneventful, lacking flavor. Overall wonderful experience. Well be back.

McAG64PjzP-UztXBuMBFFw.text: We had dinner here last night as an extension of Valentine's Day--I had read lots of recommendations and was excited to try it (Chris Bianco won the James Beard Award for Best Chef: Southwest in 2003). We had a reservation for 7:30--which was essential on a Saturday night. The place was packed. My appetite was whetted when we walked by a window into the kitchen and watched the preparation of fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil (Insalata Caprese). There was also a tray of lovely dried tomatoes bathed in olive oil sitting nearby, always a good sign. We had to wait for about twenty minutes, but there is a wine bar where you can get a glass of something to help pass the time. We were seated in the large room at the back--there are three spaces: a patio, a smaller dining room in the bar area, and the main room behind, all very noisy by the way--so if that bothers you, you won't be happy. Service was prompt, courteous, friendly, and very professional.They brought us a basked of pane with olive oil. The o.o. was light and grassy tasting, delicious, and the bread was artisanal and divine. Chris Bianco clearly knows what to do with flour and yeast.  I ordered a small plate of mozzarella with tomatoes and basil, followed by a pizza biancoverde--white pizza with mozzarella and topped with fresh local arugula. The mozzarella is home-made and delicious, the tomatoes were luscious. My pizza confirmed the restaurant's reputation as being the best pizzeria in Arizona. Great slightly charred crust, Naples style, beautiful combo of fresh cheese, herbs, and arugula. I loved it! My husband had the parpardelle with meat sauce, which was also excellent--but I'm glad I had pizza. One pizza probably wouldn't feed two people--as it was, I was able to share about a third of it with my husband and went home feeling very well fed (as did he). We will definitely be back. This restaurant is a national treasure!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza Biancoverde--beautiful crust, topped with fresh arugula. Yummy!

Wy1FO3XiCB3G2kO4XOI_Yg.text: This place is a little misleading.  About a year ago I had dinner at this exact same location and it was simply called "Italian Restaurant".  It was ok...nothing special.  A few weeks ago I notice that Pizzeria Bianco had moved in and I was super excited since I've been to the downtown location and love their food.  I was surprised to see the menu looked pretty much the same as that of the former occupant "Italian Restaurant".  I think they just added pizza to the old menu and gave it a familiar name in hopes that it would be successful.  Lame.  The pizza we had was ok but not as good as the downtown location.  I wouldn't go back.  Also, the room they seated us in smelled like paint thinner and had a very odd decor.  Not appetizing.  Our waiter was slow and my napkin was soaking wet before I even touched it.

5lSIMzcC-OwrCJtUYOs0Jg.text: AWFUL. This is my first Yelp - and I go to new places every day. I frequent places like Postino, the Parlor, St. Francis. Based on their website this looks like it fits into the same category. Nope!   First off, I'll admit that on a rainy Monday I had a hankering for soup at Baby Kays. Didn't know they are gone, so I walked across and thought - why not try a new place. I was already disappointed so I'll give them that; maybe I'm just over critical today. You be the judge. I arrived at 1pm and the place was very busy. The greeter was unkept with wet hair and seemed to have no clue. I just opted to sit at the bar.   Bar: Restaurant design 101 - SEATING! My pursehook (kudos for at least having this) was between the legs. Add that my knees still hit the wall and I'm still a good foot away from my plate and I look like the hunchback of Notre Dame at a nice dining establishment. I'm 5'3". Imagine a taller person sitting there. Not only did I drop a bite - so did my spaghetti eating neighbor. I'd be fairly interested to see how much food lands on the floor at that bar or how many more seats could they fit there if it weren't from men & women sitting spread eagle up to it.  Also, call me old fashioned, the bartender should always be behind the bar. Never was one. I wasn't needing drinks; I just think someone should be there. Maybe they were severely understaffed at 1pm on a rainy Monday?   My water glass was never refilled; I sat right next to the 'water station' at the bar, where the waitress repeatedly slammed it down next to me. Yet my glass remain empty. Perhaps if there were a bartender present?  Food: First off, I am gluten-free (not by choice). The menu is absolutely the furthest place you'd ever want to go for a gluten-free person. McDonalds has more options. Typically - Italian is not my forte with all the breads and pastas, but most all restaurants have enough options to keep a GF person happy. Many Italian restaurants make their own gluten-free pastas and pizzas - Picazzo is a favorite.   My choice? The simple salad and their wood roasted mushroom side. What I got was a plate with a mound of oily leaves and 3 seeded olives. That's it. Oily lettuce. No choice of dressing. The mushrooms were a plate full of standard button mushrooms sauteed in...you guessed it...oil! I was imagining wood fired, wild mushrooms with a twist that only this chef could create. No flavor whatsoever. I tried to trick my tastebuds with salt and switching from one bite to the other (salad, mushroom), sans water. It was so disgusting. Being that I waited so long to eat I shoveled it in to satisfy my stomach, give my knees a break and got the heck out of there.   All for a staggering $23. Would you? Sorry Chef Bianco - one lunchtime midcentral foodie fail. I have no interest in returning to this restaurant, nor trying any of the sister restaurants and am now even more eager when the long time Phoenix staple Baby Kays returns at the old Richardsons location in November!

pkxvFmaa2Hn1qZ7feQAEvA.text: Not sure what all the hype is about. Service was kind of snooty and the pizza was just ok. I'll go back if there isn't a wait but it's not my favorite place. The staff needs to work on being nicer. I have never understood why ANY restaurant has snooty staff. It's so unnecessary and turns diners off!

qh9hiVEAM9mqyfbMhUpA_w.text: I had read the reviews of Pizzeria Bianco, and I thought I'd give them a try. I stopped in to place a to go order. The hostess was disinterested in me even before I told her I was ordering to go. She led me to the bar where Blaise took my order. I saw him talking to other guests at the bar, so I knew he could be friendly, but he had very little time for my order. He took the order with very few words exchanged, and a few minutes later he left me the bill. He didn't bother to ask if I wanted a drink while I waited or even offer me a glass of water. So, I was surprised that when he came to pick up my cash payment, that he asked me "do you need change back?" I rarely leave without giving a tip, even on a to go order I usually don't leave less than 10%, but he had been so dismissive of me I told him yes I did want my change. I got my meal and left. The pizza was okay, and the service was lousy. I won't be back.

M13U_JoX9ChUJXBMwlMUVw.text: We went to this location instead of downtown for a Sunday afternoon lunch. We were extremely impressed with the staff and the food was just as incredible as the original location. We loved the decor and overall ambiance. We are so pleased to have this location!

IAYvV_1J1Z949w7amsHE3w.text: solid pizza, but to be honest it was oversold. the service was fine but i don't think i feel a need to come back here (though i wouldn't avoid it either).   we had the wiseguy because i'd seen it mentioned in so many other reviews. again, it was fine, i just wouldn't feel a need to have it again. i don't regret the decision at all, i just don't feel a need to try it again or to strongly recommend it to friends.

VyPXJ2_mUjV4lZyuFBpIvQ.text: I found the food to be EXTREMELY crunchy but tasteful. I ordered a fish. An orange one. Also, there were a lot of ingredients, just too many. I did have a wonderful beverage though.

QfotAQBlJNdsUz5kkcoUsw.text: Love this place!!! Great food and awesome atmosphere! Totally worth the wait! They also have a sandwich place called "Pane Bianco", I would highly recommend visiting.

8-7v4LHYn_-OGZYQi34aIw.text: Stopped in here to have lunch with the gf. After 5 years in the Valley I decided I would try it. Got seated right away for lunch at this newer location, so no wait. Thankfully, because if I had waited at all I would be rating this a 1 or 2.  This location, much like the other location, is hard to find and hidden. That's pretentious, plenty of restaurants want your business. This place acts like you need to earn it. We ordered a margharita with extra sausage and waited for our minds to be blown. They were. How can so many people love this pizza. It's average at best. Great fresh sausage and great basil, I'll admit, but the crust was either too burnt or too doughy. Maybe the ovens/employees at the original location are better, but unless the pizza is completely different, it will still be vastly overrated.  The service was quick, the waitress was no BS, and it really wasn't too expensive. The pizza was enough for 2 for lunch. If I liked the food, automatic 4. I honestly didn't like the pizza. That place assumes it knows what you like on your pizza, and that place does not know what I want on my pizza. I like good crust, cheese, sauce, and options. This place doesn't have much of any of those.

aY-8H-f5hfS0YDA7w8XP2Q.text: Its OK. It is not great by any stretch of the imagination, I cannot help but think HUH? when I heard it was rated 5th best in the country. By who? LOL  It is NOT even in the top 300. How can anyone who knows think otherwise?

S6toygbAfiZa0D3Ocdanyw.text: had the rosa, wiseguy and margherita pizzas!  all excellent!  Tried a local wine from cochise county and was pleasantly surprised.  Server was very good; however the hostess was hesitant to seat us.   We arrived on a saturday at 5:30 and they had reservations arriving at 7pm.   I had to promise we woukd have wine and pizza fast.  All ended up just fine.  Mangia!!

dvpo6d2_QyTGoxr_ovIB-A.text: Disappointing. Heard so much about this place and tried two pizzas. The Rosa was good, with tangy cheese and crunchy pistachios. The Wise Guy wasn't --pretty tasteless, with shoe leather sausage. We told the waiter, who asked repeatedly whether he could bring us anything else. By now too full to eat anything else, we declined, but finally ordered an espresso, for which we were charged. I won't hurry back.

JZrSNVLXWBIMgoHy7PjR7g.text: I, like everyone else, have been hearing about Pizzeria Bianco for YEARS. Even though I'm an AZ native and have had every opportunity to try the location downtown, I could just never deal with the wait. I dined at the Town and Country location attempting to not be influenced by the reputation of this Phoenix pizza champ, and this is what I came up with:  The restaurant is very inviting and, simply put, pretty. We were seated immediately outside (on a Monday at 6pm). Our sever was very attentive and helpful with the wine list. Alcohol service was slow, but that happens.   The antipasti was very good. Beets, carrots, dry cheese with peppercorns, salumi and the crusty bread acted as a great starter. We had the biancoverde pizza with added fennel sausage. I know the white pizza with its multiple cheeses and arugula is meant to be simple and flavorful on its own, but the sausage really made it. I don't have any real complaints. It was a good pizza. I guess I just expected more. Going off of just this one experience, I would take Cibo over Bianco any day.  The big shocker was the dessert. I don't have much of a sweet tooth, but my friend ordered the flourless chocolate cake and it was absolutely fantastic. I never get nutty over desserts, but this was one I will remember.  Between the two of us, we had a bottle of wine, an appetizer, a pizza and a dessert for around $100. Not bad at all as far as price points go. I did enjoy Pizzeria Bianco, but I was a bit underwhelmed. Will try it again one day if I get tired of my other favorite Phoenix pizza joints.

OpliJFSuEZQLjVA1_zZl8Q.text: Not a good meal.  Meatballs and chickpea crepes were too salty. Eggplant and spinach was an unappetizing greasy pile of slime and tasted oily.  The meatballs were accompanied by truly tasteless tomato sauce.  The pasta was nothing special.  Crispy Brussels sprouts were anything but..undercooked and chewy.   And three slices of bread was brought to the table with just enough olive oil for two slices.

KeWub3hdBHoo7RUxuDyLow.text: I really can't say that I was impressed with this place . May have to try it another day.

IszRn2auCZg1zJjvdzWUdQ.text: This was so disappointing! We had gone here because we wanted to try pasta. The atmosphere was disappointing starting from the bartenders who were not friendly and couldn't explain the dishes. Once the pasta got to us it was actually cold... but they didn't even check in to ask how it was. We ordered bread but that came after the pasta was already on the table. The pasta was salty too. It was altogether disappointing experience and I'll never go back.

9rIbhB-ghneSJLwRPrl_dA.text: * * * *  A bottle of white, a bottle of red Perhaps a bottle of rose instead We got a table against the wall It had an old familiar air My friends and I, sitting chair to chair  A bottle of red, a bottle of white It all depended upon our appetite We met for dinner, it was nonchalant In Chris Bianco's Italian Restaurant. * * * *   Within the Town and Country shopping center lies Chris Bianco's Italian Restaurant, a nod to simple, unpretentious Italian-American cuisine.  There is an emphasis on home-made, fresh ingredients, as is evident in the hand-made pastas and slow-cooked meats.  We were first served some lovely crostini with a creamy cheese (Maybe ricotta?).  We also decided on getting the cheese platter appetizer, which consisted of Brie, sheep's milk cheese, and goat milk cheese with orange marmalade and candied pecans.  It was served with a basket of bread, and a single buttery looking crostini on the cheese plate.  The bread was a little too chewy for my tastes, but the cheeses were quite nice, especially with the marmalade and pecans.    For main courses, I ordered the crespelle, and also tried the porchetta and papardelle.  The crespelle is like the Italian version of a savory crepe.  It had freshly made ricotta, spinach, and garlic, with a hearty, chunky tomato sauce.  The crespelle tasted decent, although there were large halved pieces of garlic in the filling that still had some "bite" to them because they weren't fully cooked.  The papardelle I tried had a nice meaty ragu to accompany the fresh pasta.  The porchetta was easily the best item out of all our meals.  The slow-roasted pork was very tender, and the sauce had a nice full flavor that matched well with the pork, black-eyed peas, and root vegetables.    I was kind of torn on what to give Italian Restaurant rating-wise, since the pasta dishes, although impressive that they were freshly made, just tasted OK to me (A 3 star for just the pasta).  However, the porchetta and friendly service helped tip the scales so I'll upgrade to a 4 star rating.

Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Porchetta

FfGYk3GAut9ljnR4Ra1WkA.text: High price place not worth the hype! Pizza was OK but have had much better for half the price.

oFEDAwjoJwsUyXbWQlQEBw.text: I've heard so many people say that this place is a must go for Arizona!  When I was at another restaurant the guy said that there's people who fly out here just to eat.   I'm a big fan of New York Style pizza and I was hoping for something like that.   The ambiance was nice vintage like, very cute setting. When I got the menu there's definitely more drinks on it than food. I felt like the Pizza place should of been called Wine and Bite. For someone like me who enjoys trying new food. It's False adverstiment Pizzeria Bianco... geez

ZLcD6Hj4oA9sKdA3jL_5qg.text: This place is pretty spectacular. Any fan of pizza should definitely try it.  There is a certain celebrity chef that told me this place has the best pizza you can have in the United States, I was shocked since the man is from New York. He wasn't wrong.

ARiIBMs0u9kzhhTf2Moqig.text: I went here with a large group of women and shared lots of different pizzas, salads, and pasta. And wine! The wine and drink list was nice and included sophisticated Italian style cocktails. The special pasta of the night was Bucatini with pork ragu, chard, and fontina. Really beautiful al dente pasta that was perfectly balanced, not too salty or heavy. The Margherita pizza was perfect and brick oven fired. Really a gorgeous and perfect margherita. The interior was gorgeous, wth different areas to suit any size party. There was an orange and fennel salad on the menu that I sadly missed this time. You won't be sorry you went here!

tQ8bYY-ke45GaLnD6jiOSg.text: Pizzeria Bianco did everything they could to make my evening with my grandmother extra special.  We went to the Town & Country location, although we're now super eager to try the others.  Every aspect of our meal was delicious and beautifully prepared, from start to finish.  Our waitress was so lovely and truly set the tone for our experience.  The atmosphere is charming and feels like a bistro in the Italian countryside.  My grandmother and I were very impressed by the level of graciousness they showed while serving us.  Ten stars, if I could.

mfzT9GFCANRzzQk5LYe38g.text: FIVE STARS on the pizza but prefer the original Heritage Square location by a mile!  While the pizza was superb, as always, the wine list decent, and the service friendly, the noise level at this restaurant was almost unbearable.   There's "good noise" (high energy, good music, fun conversations) and there's "bad noise" (servers banging dishes and silverware, chefs preparing food with over the top loud fanfare, toddlers crying and screaming out, loud echos because of lack of sound barriers, etc.---- it was literally a headache in the making to dine there.   So, we won't return to this location... will leave it to the young families with kids and millennials who probably don't even notice the noise!

-2ugurwS3hPvlu15rkP1ww.text: Came here on a tip from a local that I was visiting and I was not disappointed. This has to be the most professional pizza place I have ever been to. This place had valet parking for one which I was not used to for pizza but then realized that it was valid for the entire street of venues. The pizza was made in a brick oven which gave it that perfect crispiness that I always look for when eating pizza. I ordered a pie that came with onions, sausage and cheese.. no marinara. Next time I will get a pizza with Marinara because the one I tried was a little dry for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Damn good pizza

vrB-jIMlG0dhMsGrxbgHfg.text: Best pizza I've ever eaten, hands down. Highly recommend. Very friendly owners, relaxing atmosphere and very delicious food.

t3-CYWQ5L78PNkzNgoP8Pw.text: This was my third Pizzeria Bianco meal.  The first two were at the other location in 2009 and 2013.  It's hard to evaluate whether the pizza has changed in the intervening years, but I suppose I am a little less impressed than I used to be.  Neapolitan pizza is much more widely available than it used to be, and a lot of the novelty of the Pizzeria Bianco experience has worn off.  Arugula on pizza, for example, seems to be found all over the place.  It is admittedly the style of Neapolitan pizzas to be thin crust and light on toppings, but, still, it feels like you are paying a high price for a lot of white flour.  The menu is short and the toppings don't seem to be particularly labor intensive or require too much in the way of craft or artistry.  Bottom line: pretty good pizza but perhaps not anything too special.

iwQQ78BnOsnRYpHtD52EKg.text: I wish I could give this place more stars but I can't! The food was great don't get me wrong, but our first experience wasn't the best. Quick service which is always great, but talk about feeling unwelcome! For a first timer, it would've been nice to be introduced to the menu instead of asking 101 questions. That seems to be a problem I've been reading through other reviews. The servers seem to dislike assisting their customers when it comes to the menu. I really wanted to like this place but it's not worth a second visit. 2 stars for the delicious food. -3 stars for the service and overall atmosphere.

tMHsZvEbUddJoSG1v9sKsg.text: The fresh mozzarella is to die for! Being a Jersey girl I know the real thing and this is the REAL thing! I could see into the kitchen and watched the cook making nice big balls of mozzarella. I asked if we could take balls to go and unfortunately they don't sell it that way. We had the mozzarella and tomato on Focaccia bread and the tomato and mozzarella salad. Both were moist and mouth watering! We loved it so much we  ordered a plain pizza to go. The pizza was cooked on a beautiful wood burning stove but it was just ok. The pizza was sort of dry and disappointed it wasn't better since this seems to be their speciality. The interior of this place is super cute and the back dining room was even more cute. Shabby chic is the decor and it fit perfectly. Almost felt as if we were in someone's home. Service was quick and prompt. Would have given 5 stars if the pizza was better.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back dining room
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomato and fresh mozzarella salad! SPECTACULAR!!!

MwqaEi73k_X4qp0u38yOmA.text: Abandoned by my wife, I was forced to fend for myself in a new city. So I found this place through an eater article for lunch.   Granted I came during off hours, service was excellent. It's kind of silly but I was sitting outside and the wind swept away my napkin. By the time I picked it up, the waiter had a new napkin for me. Slightly stalker-ish but there weren't a lot of people there so I appreciated the extra attention.   Service started with two black olives and a green olive. Since I was a little hesitant about olives at first, the waiter brought out some bread and olive oil as well.   Since it was just me, I went classic and got the Margherita pizza. Pizza was pretty good but not the best that I've had. Thin crust, crispy yet yielding. Wood fired oven gave it a nice cook with a little bit of that char. Sauce was solid, but would have preferred it a touch sweeter and a little more acid.   Finished off the pizza and decided on a whim to get a lemon curd. It was a lot for one person but bursting with lemon flavor. They topped it with a vanilla cream and two soft and crumbly shortbread cookies on the side to counterpunch the sour. Thought it worked well. Recommended for those who like citrus.   Based on the pizza alone I might have rounded down from 3.5 to 3, but the service certainly made it an enjoyable meal.   4/5.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita $15
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon curd $8

dmMPW3eRvjvNOA2C0ZHiMA.text: Surprised this location has a much lower rating than the original. This one is for the locals who dont have to wait in line. Definitely try out the downtown one just to "experience" it but nothing is different.   Live almost across the street so we venture here often. They have a really good pie - fresh ingredents, great crust. I just cant give them a full 5 stars based on price. For a thin smaller size pizza, they are a tad bit pricey but hey...least you get good food for your money

3T0COwKgY21cNdZuvAHz7Q.text: First time at this other location & definitely not disappointed. This place does pizza right in their glorious wood burning oven. delicious & no wait on a Monday dinner time. Love the complimentary top notch bread & olive oil. Just divine. I consider drinking the leftover olive oil each time there's a drop left. It's seriously that good. Instead of salad we got the Spiedini wood fired skewers of proscuitto wrapped fontina & while on the salty side of life it was really good ingredients & simply delish. I'd recommend it with a stiff whiskey drink or full bodied red to tame the salt. I was sporting the fresh brewed iced tea as the DD & it was a bit much. Love this place from start to finish. Service, ambiance & of course the simple Italian dishes with superior ingredients will keep us coming back for years to come.

NSn_1y4zPXXbAiRz4_kIHA.text: What can I say. I'm an east coast Italian/Irish guy! This place is great! And I've gotta say I've got a man crush on Chris. Such a brilliant and really just a nice guy.  I've had all the pizza's there and admit to loving the Rosa, the wise guy, but obviously the margherita.   The pappardelle bolognese? YUM! There was a gnocchi dish he had some time back, YUM!  Great place, ambiance is warm and somewhat rustic, service is great and the food is fantastic. I love that he doesn't try and OVERDO it. Simple is very satisfying!

jUmtFFZQRRC4BGLFJsQRfw.text: I absolutely love this place, I have been to this location as well as the one on Adams in downtown Phoenix, I have had great experiences at both but the line is always less at this one , usually no wait at all. I have tried multiple Pizza and never had a bad one, the crust is perfect every time, the perfect amount of char on the bottom, and delicious crust all around. I personally haven't tried any of the appetizers or other entrees, I usually go there and just get pizza and they are always amazing. One time me and a friend went during lunch and there was not many people there and Chris Bianco came out and spoke with us for a few minutes discussing Pizza, he is a very cool guy and made us feel very welcome and answered all of our questions.

u8Xn3RI-9UnxxGOOmm4L5A.text: NEVER AGAIN.  Oh, wait.  The term, "never again" commonly refers to the holocaust, not this restaurant.  But seriously...  One night, I thought, what the hell, pizza from the best, right?  Pizza Margarita, $10-$15.  So I go, and I ask, "...can you add sausage and mushroom?", and the guy says sure.  I'm not kidding you: $5 DOLLARS FOR SAUSAGE, $3 FOR MUSHROOMS...ON A $10 PIZZA.  I checked two pizza parlors, at random, who have owners without Chrissy Bianco's ego, and for an 18" pizza, to add sausage, they charge $1.75.  A dollar seventy five!  But not Bianco!  FIVE DOLLARS!    Listen, I've made money, had money, lost money; it's my opinion that $5 for sausage on a 10-12" pizza is pure narcissism.  It's just silly.  And I'll never, EVER come back.  $5 for sausage, you jagwod!  Take your sopressata and leave me alone!  Pretentious, expensive, really pretentious.  Nope.  Never again.

JsQG-c9qbGF33XcamApIRg.text: 2x unsweetened ice tea  Free crusty table bread with olive oil.   Margherita pizza Add mushrooms Add fennel sausage on 1/2  The pizza was fantastic. The wood fired oven brings a wonderful smoky char to the crust that you only get from wood or coal ovens. The pizza also comes out super quick because of the higher oven temps. The sauce was a perfect tangy tomato. Just the right amount of fresh mozzarella and fresh basil. The fresh mushrooms provided an earthy flavor that is perfect for pizza. The fennel sausage was both mildly spicy and full of that licorice-like flavor. Loved it!  $40

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kitschy dining room.
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wood fired oven
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pizza is that good!

30JELuCebYmiADmC03pZwA.text: I think the price really comes to the atmosphere of the restaurant. It is pretty chic and smaller/cozy.   The pizza and flavors of pizza I think are great, it's just a little pricey for what you get. We got the sonny one. It was fine. We also got the "just greens" salad and it was just lettuce, but it was drenched in the oil/vinegar. After every bite I drank about a glass of water.   I dunno, I hate mentioning other places in a review, but there are other wood fire pizza places in the area that are quite literally half the price.

eROpOA7unOIxGxpbRm-_HQ.text: I'm baffled at how this place got named best pizza in Phoenix.  We got a pizza with sausage & onions.  It was  soggy and so bland that I had to add salt & pepper because there was no parmesan or red pepper flakes on the table. I asked for a side of red sauce to seek some improvement but ended up even more disappointed as it tasted like it was straight out of a metal can.    I also got the seasonal salad with peaches and white balsamic vinegar. The peaches were nowhere near ripe and it tasted like the salad was just drowned in straight olive oil. Nothing appealing or refreshing about this small $15 salad.   There was nobody in the restaurant but 5 servers and we still managed to have terrible service. There are far better places in the Valley for good pizza and Italian food.  Mora has this place beat hands down. We will not be returning to Pizzeria Bianco.

jpmv1eeKatTZyGoNRv3p7A.text: I was told that this place had the best pizza, which made me skeptical but oh man did they ever deliver! The pizza was wonderful and we were pleasantly surprised by some flavor combinations that we wouldn't have normally tried that we amazing!   We ordered the Marinara, Rosa and wiseguy and they were all so flavorful! The table favorite was the Rosa. The pistachios were such an I retesting addition. The marinara sauce they use is soo delicious. Sweet and savory!  Highly recommend coming here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wiseguy Pizza

D5uODHBHU0MAwskxiLu7kA.text: Wanted to try the famous pizzeria Bianco, it was easy to get in , great service quick and great crust in the pizza.

_XIJy77Hq4dPQrDRJQ4zjg.text: I don't quiet understand how this is a top pizza spot in Arizona. The pizza and even the pasta were beyond oily. I felt like I needed to wash my hands every three seconds. It was so bad. Nothing stayed on the slice, it would just all slip off. I left feeling horrible.   - WISEGUY PIZZA: you'll love this if you love onions. Their onion pieces are triple if not larger than what they normally are. Fennel Sausage were also large and dry - PASTA SPECIAL: oily, no real taste. Fennel sausage didn't add much to the dish. Could barely taste the peppers added.   If you're close by this place maybe worth seeing for yourself, but if you have to go out of your way to eat here, don't.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wise Guy
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fennel Pasta

VrVwDSWdBTcXvMz7nRHNZg.text: We visited this place during our stay in Arizona from California. We ordered Biancoverde, Wiseguy, Sonny Boy and Rosa Pizza. Their crust is so thin and crispy. My personal favorite is Rosa. The amount of cheese is just right. The pistachios and red onion work really well together. The aroma from the rosemary is amazing. Sonny Boy is my least favorite coz it's kinda too salty for my liking. Tips when ordering, don't order all your pizza at one go as the crust will get soggy if you don't eat it right away. The staff is very friendly and attentive. Highly recommend this place to pizza lovers when you visit Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wiseguy Pizza and Biancoverde Pizza
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rosa Pizza
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonny Boy Pizza

s3WQJid_djEemgA0gpiD7Q.text: We first tried Pizzeria Bianco at the OG location in downtown Phoenix and I wasn't that huge of a fan.  That was many moons ago.   We came to this location as my brother wanted to try it out.  The restaurant is MUCH larger than the OG.  Service is great and the food was delicious!  Not only did they have pizzas there, they also had appetizers, salads and pastas.  A little bit of something for everyone.  Since we were a large party, we basically almost ordered 1 of everything on the menu and shared it family style.  Everything was very good and we didn't really even have anything to take home as we finished it all while we were there.  I will definitely be back since they have more options than just the pizza.

9Jf3wXBThvOayiGwdPxYnA.text: Ohhhhh that crust and quality ingredients!  pizzeria Bianco is such a great quality pizza! I'm having a hard time rating this pizza! It's definitely a solid 4, so close to a 5 star, for me, it came down to; "the pizza is a bit soggy in the middle of the pie," However, the edges make up for it! I could eat everyone's edges, if they'd let me! I think if I saw someone leaving the end of the pizza crust, there could be an altercation!  We ordered the Sonny Boy, and the Pappadelle with Bolognese sauce. The homemade pasta was cooked perfectly, the sauce was thick and full of meat! We added wood roasted mushrooms,on our pizza! If you love mushrooms, it's a must! Absolutely delicious! Service is great, and the entrees come out SUPER FAST!  It's not really inexpensive, but I think in comparison to other pizzas we've had in the valley, for the quality and style, it's right there!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappardelle pasta with meat sauce
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sunny Boy with wood oven mushrooms
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sonny Boy, added wood oven mushrooms! Delicious

Dcym-bfQMPjrlKhYafkBOg.text: I'm breaking my own rule of writing a review based off a one time visit, by reviewing Pizzeria Bianco, but there's good reason why. For one thing, I don't live in Phoenix, near Phoenix, or even in the same state. In fact, I live 2 time zones away and approximately a 4.5 hour plane ride. So sadly, I won't be returning anytime soon. And I say sadly, because Pizzeria Bianco serves up some of the best damn pizza I've ever had.   I've always been a firm believer in eating local and trying what a region is known for. AZ ain't exactly known for pizza so when my buddy suggested we get pizza in Phoenix, I was skeptical. But I did a little research and Pizzeria Bianco sounded legit.   How legit was it might you ask? Legit - with a capital L. I should also mention that I am only reviewing the pizza. I can't speak for their other Italian offerings, drinks, etc. But based on pizza alone, this was a five star experience all the way.  The perfect thin crust - chewy yet crunchy. A really nice sauce - not too sweet or bitter but a really nice balance. And cheese - not too much, not too little, not overpowering or too mild but just right. If there is a God, he is eating this caliber of pizza.   No, Chris Bianco did not hand make this pizza himself, but show me the man or lady who did, and I will give you the highest of high fives.   Yes, our waitress was a low talker and it was hard to understand her. And yes, a pizza here isn't cheap, but you pay for quality and quality is what you get.   I don't plan on visiting PHX again anytime soon, but you best believe that when I do, I will be running back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita

bnTPbS1Ee-GxpLtkcuWjog.text: Ambiance is nice for a relaxing, laidback date night if you wanted. We had an attentive waitress, but we got some awkward/weird vibes from her, like somewhat robotic and not as personable as we would have expected.  Nonetheless, here's a review of the food. Between 3 people, we shared:  -Spiedini (fontina wrapped in Prosciutto): 5/5, highly recommend, so delicious and comes with extra greens to eat it with  -Margherita pizza: 5/5, a True classic done well (and prob our favorite dish)  -Half Wise Guy, half Rosa pizza: 3/5 for both types, I respect their attempt to go unique, but we all unanimously agreed that the Rosa pizza tasted a bit like eating a pine tree (but not in a bad way!) and the Wise Guy tasted like smoked whiskey. Worth a try and both weren't bad, but also probably not my choice of pizza for the future.  -Pappardelle pasta: 4/5, pretty good pasta, a little bit muted in flavor  Overall, it was still an enjoyable meal and I'm glad we tried it. However, I'm reluctant to say it's a place I would regularly frequent or highly recommend to someone visiting Phoenix.

-NJBz1gDo0KqbvhiFpHuLw.text: We went there with another couple. Service was quick and staff was friendly. We ordered half Sonny and half wise men pizza and the market pasta. I had some prosecco and my fiance had some lemonade that was very tasty. Everything was great and tasted very good. Pasta was the right amount to split and very tasty. Overall great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Market pasta

njxLex-pGS4wt1znuKvgHQ.text: Underwhelming experience. My husband and I chose to go here for my birthday. No one acknowledged my birthday even though my husband noted it on the reservation. We had the caprese, a salad, and a sausage pizza. I really wanted to like it given the well known chef/owner and I was expecting something amazing only to be let down by the average food and mediocre service. The wait staff were like robots and were not personable at all acting as if they did not want to be there. We went to The Parlor for a drink prior and wish we would have just stayed there for dinner.

nriJmdxqEgbqOwafxMf-2g.text: I came to Phoenix to meet my sister from NY; she was attending a conference for work and I was just going to hang out and be a tourist. I moved to El Paso, Texas, from NY about 10 years ago and even though we have great artesian pizza places, I have been hankering for that Brooklyn style pizza- so that was my quest while in Phoenix. I figured they are a large city and should have some... So, my friends that live out here told me there was no Brooklyn pizza to be found in Phoenix. I went onYelp to search and found this place. It had 4.5 stars with over 2300 reviews- this sounded like a sure bet- it may not be Brooklyn style but it must be delicious! We arrived at the location and walked down a short Path with other eateries and interesting type shops. We got to the pizza place and it looked like a place in Italy- very quaint and smelling amazing!!!! The menu had pastas and other meals in addition the pizza- but we were in a mission. We ordered two whit pie combinations on one pie (half on one side and half on the other). We were seated in the front eating space and could watch the pies being made and going into the wood burning oven. There is a dining room in the back but recommend making reservations for that space. There were family photos in frames on a wood bureau and there were expansive windows so you could look out onto the outdoor seating space. We also ordered drinks (hey take advantage of Uber) and the Prosecco was very good. The pie came out and it looked awesome. We took our first bites and were were so happy! The toppings and flavors were high end. The crust was cooked to have a slight char but it was still soft and foldable (like Brooklyn style); this is what I was looking for. They did not disappoint!!!! If you are having cravings for some great pizza, this is the place you need to try out!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half and half wiseguy and bianco

is1L6ygjQVzLcJvYpsPSkA.text: Take it from someone who could eat pizza every day, this crust is the real deal and made me feel like I was back in the hallowed halls of Da Michele in Napoli. If you, too, are a pizza aficionado, you won't even really need to read more. But I want to write more because I so enjoyed my time here recently at a large group dinner.   We started off with 2 salads that had been veganized, a delicate fennel and citrus and a simple - but so fresh, it seemed right out of the garden  - mixed green variety. Combined with thick crusty slices of an artisanal country bread, I could have easily made a meal of this and a side of roasted mushrooms. But of course I didn't leave it at that. Despite the fact that I could have had pasta, also made vegan, I had to indulge in their specialty.  There is a marinara pizza on the menu that is already vegan, but I also added gaeta olives and the aforementioned buttery, sans butter, mushrooms. I can't even talk to you about how good this was. If you know me, I am prone to what I call "food fugues" and I ain't gonna lie, this happened here.   This may be all you need to know.  But I'll go on. The service is impeccable. They took such good care of our large group that I can only imagine how perfetto things would be with a friend or two. Even better, the dark, intimate atmosphere would lend itself so well to a date.

7gVKD1BBWRTzc9ItiPr9fQ.text: They say this is the best pizza in AZ.   Pizza is probably my favorite food and I'd rather go here than any other place in AZ.    I can eat a whole pie ($16 by myself).  As far as the type of pizza, i'd say it's very close to Brazilian pizza which is like NYC but more soft, "watery" and fresh everything.  I also liked they had my favorite moscato on the menu, Michele Chiarlo Moscato d'Asti.

Z-UxGTRMBYP3Gi1rJKS-3g.text: It's in my top 3 places for pizza.  Not sure what order the list would be in but this place is for sure some of the best Pizza I ever had.  Light thin tasty  crust, tomato sauce on the pizza taste like they took a fresh ripe tomato and blended it and spread some out on the dough and just enough cheese.  The cheese is also fresh and not salty or oily.   Some fresh basil leaf for flavor and color.    On a scale from one to ten I say 11.   If you are I. The area it's a must try.

1-mlSyvkNAt9DyC2nsCWFQ.text: The pizza and the special they had were delicious. I will have to visit their downtown location.

eIHowPABCYM_R_suxZkmQw.text: Super rainy and here for spring training. My first time here and it didn't disappoint.  We got the spaghetti and margherita pizza.  Yes, we are boring, but I don't like to be adventurous on a new place. Service was solid.  The wait ended up being close to 15/20 minutes. I would definitely come to this place again, if i was in town. It was quite memorable and worth the small wait. Only small complaint would be the portions were kind of on the smaller end. But still tasty and high quality.
