Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Salad
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 2017 Menu

coflaY8SAXNFbWdR8vSWiA.text: Not only was the pizza perfect, but the pasta of the day, sunday, was gravy, slow cooked and amazing. Terrific bread, butter, olive oil and olives were all great.  Server was spot on with everything.  Magnificent meat balls were a STEAL, and couldn't get enough of the great red sauce that came with the meatballs.  Can wait to return.

x_PIB4uF96VmFSBgvoFHPw.text: I'm new to some of the more authentic pizza places in the valley. Recently trying craft 64, parlor and now Pizzeria Bianco. Of those 3, Pizzeria Bianco is definitely my favorite. And it absolutely annihilates any "mainstream" pizza place you can think of (Pizza Hut, Papa Johns, dominoes.. etc) they shouldn't even really be compared. Pizzeria Bianco is pizza done right!!

o4jlAKFO5wNVTNrnazb7qw.text: So...it has been three years since I have eaten here. I have heard all the hype about how great this restaurant is since my last visit. We went with friends and found the dining room is inviting. When you walk into the back dining area it feels like you are in someone s dining room. It is very inviting. The Caprese salad was delicious. The tomatoes actually tasted like tomatoes back east. The mozzarella had a lot of flavor. We were told they make their own. My friend ordered the chicken dish with fingerling potatoes. She said it had good flavor but there was very little chicken, mostly potatoes. The Pasta wth meat and bolognese sauce had good flavor but was a small amount of pasta. I ordered the Wise Guy pizza with sausage and cheese but was told by the waiter that there was no marinara sauce on it? HUH? So he recommended the margarita pizza and add sausage for an extra charge. The pizza had very little sausage and maybe a few tablespoons of cheese. The crust was overcooked on the edges but the center was soggy.   The prices are HIGH . Really,  one pizza for $25? I thought all the prices were high. The service last time was good. this time, fair, saw the waiter once. My drink was never refilled and no one ever checked on us.   This is strictly my opinion and I know many people love this place but frankly this place needs some work. As I previously stated, The Parlor right across the street is so much better. Obviously Phoenicians like to pay BIG prices for dough with sauce and little else. I won't be back.

h95nuzEpc1GqRmSSqKUY9Q.text: Margarita pizza with fennel sausage is the best pizza ever! But poor service ruined what started as a great date night with my spouse. Had to wait for table, no problem got a glass of wine, paid and waited. Ordered a $15 plate of watermelon and a few minutes later our pizza arrived. Asked for salad to go. Bill arrived and we were charged for wine from bar and salad that now for into a soup cup. Oh and the noise. It was so loud we were yelling to hear each other. To go or weeknight, but not a place for amweodyay

FlqRuX2KUuak0p0y1Jz3hQ.text: First time here. Ordered the Pappardelle homemade pasta with Bolognese. Very very good. Sat outside on this beautiful day. Most surprised that no one asked me if I'd like a beverage or glass of wine. The pizza at the neighboring table looked fabulous. I will return.

bAjzpot7QfiaIkAlLjmLHg.text: I have to say, I am normally not a fan of these brick oven gourmet pizza places, as they tend to be too thin, the cheese and toppings sliding off the pizza, and to me, that just isn't pizza.    But Pizzeria Bianco... now they are different.  I was blown away by everything with the pizza.  It held together, delicious cheese, toppings, and crust.  I had no expectations other than low ones coming here, and seeing other reviews I see that it was rated the best pizza in the whole USA.  That may be a bit much, but it would at the very least be in the running for the best pizza in Arizona and maybe the Southwest (AZ, NV, NM).    As I said before, I am not a huge fan of this type of pizza, I usually avoid it, but I will definitely come back to this location as I was pleasantly surprised.  As a big fan of pizza... possibly a connoisseur, I definitely recommend coming here.  The interior wasn't anything special and the seats weren't the most comfortable, as everything in the place is pretty old, but who cares, you're coming for the pizza!

zI3adOHjhkywcZzm_XnP8A.text: Wow, $29 bucks for a personal pizza and a salad. I'm sure there is some special ingredients or certified oven but Wow. The thin crust pizza (wise guy) was good and the salad was nothing special. I score a 6.3774. Large parking lot but the gym and Trader Joe's takes a lot of spots so I had to walk a bit.

OkD7VU6MCJyhhkeqFPihKg.text: We walked in and it was slow. We waited 7 mins until someone approached. Again, it was slow. We were taken outside where a condescending blonde waitress took our order. She was unpleasant and acted like we were beneath her. The pizza was OK...certainly nothing impressive especially when there are so many better pizza joints to enjoy! The toppings were a joke and when I mentioned I couldn't taste the garlic she begrudgingly brought enough strong RAW garlic to choke a horse! We ordered salads that were way overpriced and included greens, vinaigrette, and a few olives. Wow that salad should have been a fraction of what they charge!!! It was way too expensive for what you got, the outside atmosphere was eh, and our waitress acted like she hated her job and her customers. The four of us will not be back.

N2vs2SYakBuFAxjMpb0yNA.text: Pizza and Pasta...it can't get much better.  We split the Margherita Pizza and added Wood Fired Roasted Mushrooms and the Bolognese Pasta. The pizza was a nice size, crispy and the cheese was very fresh.  The pasta was homemade and the sauce was plentiful with lots of meat.  The staff and waitress were very friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere makes it a nice place for date.

0vUgLKu0JAJL0ItkshC0FQ.text: We came here before the 49ers vs. cardinals football game. The place was a bit small and crowded. The pizza was just ok. The pizza crust was good. The beer was pricey. I would not come here again. A bit expensive. one small pizza and two beers equals $50.00. Valet parking for $5.00 plus tips. It's only Pizza man!

Lk1ZtNwKTOqbtNpXRYJOlQ.text: 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 stars.   There was a lot of hype around this place so I was excited to try it. I do know that in general it's hard for me to be impressed by a pasta/pizza place.   We came to this location right at 11:00am (when they open) on a Sunday. Service was great. The decor is nice and you can see them making your pizza in the oven.   We ordered a half and half pizza of margherita and rosa (which had red onions, parmesan, rosemary and pistachios), and the pappardelle pasta (beef bolognese and parmigiano reggiano). They also gave us a small bowl of olives (in a tasty marinade!) and some "bread sticks" (which was pretty much their crust on their pizza).   I enjoyed the pizza, but I didn't think it was AMAZING though I could tell the ingredients they use are very high quality and fresh. You can't go wrong with a margherita pizza so I enjoyed that. I love tomato sauce on pizza though (the more the better) so I wasn't a fan of the Rosa though the boyfriend enjoyed it. He actually said the bread sticks were the star of the meal! The pasta as well was good but not amazing. The pappardelle noodles were great, but the sauce was a little oily for my taste.   I'm glad I got to give this place a try and would be willing to go again if other people wanted to check it out (and we could get a bunch of other dishes to share).

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half and half pizza of margherita + Rosa.
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pappardelle (grass fed beef bolognese + parmigiano reggiano). THOSE NOODLES!

Qhp5LVr3cbergpwah3grQg.text: 1st time trying Pizzaria Bianco and it won't be my last. Had the  margherita pizza it was simply awesome. Can't wait to try the others!

26dUH_S8tvgysl8taR3lWw.text: 8/8, 5pm.  The service was about average & the margherita pizza was average.  The prices were a little expensive.  I could see this being a better visit if I had brought a date to this place, as this place seems to cater to couples & groups better than the random single traveler.  The visit wasn't bad, but it could have been better.

oZSnXQkEu-JvV3Ng7094FA.text: Underwhelming... That said, you should give this place a try as maybe your experience will be better than mine?  I should give 2 stars, but that may be a bit unfair...here's why:  Positives: -Clean, simple, easygoing vibe. -Simple, straightforward menu. -Good, simple wine selection. -Smiles everywhere.  Negatives: -My friends pizza came out before mine. -When my pizza came out, it was cold. -My Margherita pizza was not very good. -Inattentive service and it wasn't busy. -Took forever to pay my bill.  There you have it... Find out for yourself.

O_3uMJNii76msundBYz5_Q.text: Hmm... Let me see if I can break it down.  It is a nice enough atmosphere quite clean and fresh. The customer service is great really attentive, besides a few people who seem just a smidge snooty. The chicken salad we had was very good besides the dressing on the greens bit to heavy on acid makes the face pucker. The rest if the dish was very tasty. We had the sonny boy pizza. It was underwhelming. We appreciate the brick oven however ours was actually burnt and the flavor of burn came through a bit to much on the end of the taste. I had a glass of wine that I like however I could buy the whole bottle for what the glass cost me that's not necessary. Overall we will likely choose other options here in Phoenix we were a little disappointed we did not have the same stellar reviews others have.

vAeBhKkHmPSU8-WeVUlBfQ.text: Tried this location for the first time because it was closer to an event my friends an I were attending.  My first cocern were the number of review compared to the other location.  We ordered 2 Wise Guys and 3 garden salads.  When the salads arrived the lettuce had lots of brown spots on all the salads.  I was embarrassed because I hyped this place to my friends.  They all pretended not to notice but most did not finish.    Would have rated lower but the Pizza did not disappoint.  Will not be coming here anymore.

Vb4jPEDVQr1qAp_FQHgnIA.text: Not to be confused with Pizzeria Bianco at 4743 N 20th St, the Town and Country mall in Phoenix.  There is no Scottsdale location! Follow the web link and get the correct address, you won't regret it! 602-368-3273

tOO96YSz7eXJ40FLpkf8xg.text: The reviews of PB at the T&C Center look pretty mixed. Which I understand, since I myself have had mixed experiences here over the past year or so. Been here about 10 times total: happy hour side, fine dining side and take out.  THE GOOD- -Good to great ingredients used for their dishes. Obviously this place is most famous for its pizza. And I agree, it is frequently tasty. At times delicious...at other times just good...sometimes just-OK. It depends: did they burn the crust? Did they ration the cheese/sauce/toppings properly? If all is done well here, it's quite good. Not THE BEST...but nonetheless very delish.  -Homemade pastas; love it!  -Really like the decor in the fine dining room. (Can live without the bumpkins who chow on the fine dining side in cargo shorts and poopy sandals, though.) The happy hour side is a little cramped, but that's fine...it's what you'd get in the city... or Milan... or anywhere crowded.   -The bussers: honestly I think the bussers here are sometimes better than the servers. They are on top of water & bread re-fills; and dirty plate takeaways. Very efficient.  -Parking: plenty on all sides of the T&C Center, chief.  THE MEH- -The menu is small and some of the items offered are less-than-inspired. Frequently the salads are lazy. Like, they are **halfway** to being complete salads. STOP SERVING mixed greens + olives + parmesan and calling it a "salad". Maybe this passes for something in Torino...but in !!AMURICA!!, we demand more ingredients, paisan!  THE NOT-SO-GOOD- Some of the servers are GREAT. Some of the servers are just Cute But Don't Know A Lot About Food. We had such a gal on our last visit, which was a good meal. But when you don't know what you're serving, it causes problems. For example, Cutie Gal recommended the "key lime pie" for dessert, saying it's one of the best items on the dessert menu. NOT. First of all, the "pie" was actually a "tart", which is MUCH different. Plus, it was 97% citrus and 3% sugar, i.e. not suitable to eat and certainly not a dessert. We sent it back. The menu here isn't that big - I'd want the servers to at least be familiar with it.  In all, a flawed restaurant, yes. But usually good service, nice atmosphere and quality dishes. Through trial-and-error, you'll learn the better items on the menu and better times to visit. A little pricey, but a solid, good experience on most nights.

MPHLj-qGRxURSJqiPT3Y8g.text: The food here is outstanding.  I reiterate my previous 5 star rating from last year.  We waited 5 minutes for a table and had our food within 10 minutes of ordering.  The pizza is spectacular and the pasta doesn't disappoint.  I think they could do better with the dessert menu but overall it's fantastic.

Gg6drnq9TTnfOIJPICti7Q.text: Amazing wood fired oven pizza. They have a small dining room but it just adds to the ambiance of the place. My fiance and I shared a salad and a pizza and we loved it so much that we ordered one to go so we could eat it later- it was just as good for dinner!

r7qvJW4ChYBJstCCwHqSPg.text: Food was great. Customer service was okay. Felt like we were being rushed and then we were amazed that after just 2 hours they "politely" said that they needed our table for another party and basically asked us to leave - after spending over $400! Please note that we are a group of mature women who were talking and catching up. We weren't loud or annoying. They just needed our table. Won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great dinner - poor customer service.

MHDjkZ0DNn3EOrj6YQxNyA.text: Tried pizzeria Bianco for the first time for lunch today.  I shared a biancoverde with my friend and it was the perfect amount.    The cheese was great quality and the arugula was fresh.  The pizza wasn't oily like a lot of white pizza's can be.  The best part was the crust. It has a great texture; soft yet lightly charred and crisp on the bottom.  Something most pizza joints on the west coast can't seem to get right.  As a bonus they serve some great Italian bread with olive oil while you wait for your food.   Now I'm looking forward to my next visit so I can try the tomato sauce.

vV9Wss0zMwVBVqFwO1jDVQ.text: So I was beyond excited to try this Pizza, my friend and another foodie, swore by the pizza. Unfortunately I must of visited on an off day. I ordered the 1/2 wiseguy and the other 1/2 biancoverde. I did not care at all for the biancoverde, very bitter parmesan and the flavors just didn't mesh for me. The wiseguy was really flavorful, the sausage and carmelized onions blended really well. The problem for the 2 star revue, the crust was BURNT!!! FOR ME IF YOU CHARCOAL THE CRUST YOU KILL THE FLAVOR OF THE PIZZA.  All you taste is the burnt flavor of dough. I did address this issue with my server, her reply" because it is woodfire oven that is how the pizza comes out, if you are use to a brick oven the flavor will be different" . Ok just for the record I have had pizza from all over, cooked in various ovens. It is not supposed to be burnt, no matter what oven you cook it in. Funny thing was the couple next to me got a pizza and guess what ?? It wasn't burnt, crazy thing came out of the same oven!!!! So for the lack of customer service and the burnt crust it is a 2 for me. Especially for the price you would expect a great pizza!!!!

dmr00ASVFBTvZJcl3UXDGQ.text: Quality of ingredients 5 star. Pizza , capresse, and mixed greens 4.5 star. The rest of the menu 3 star, with the exception of the flourless chocolate cake, 5 star.

Fji9c-LA0CQqzUEZQBv-AQ.text: We had dinner there to celebrate my sisters birthday and I can't say enough great things about this place.  The ambiance for starters really made the place feel cozy, and was full of eclectic vintage decor.  The service was outstanding suggesting several wonderful plates all of which were equally fantastic.  The food tasted fresh, all the portions were perfect, and I found the prices to be very fair.  We had a wonderful time and even got to meet Chris Bianco.  I would highly recommend this wonderful place to anyone looking for a wonderful meal with the family to a romantic quaint date with your significant other.  Thanks Pizzeria Bianco for a great experience!

n5rSeP7pXB-X3o_p6Jw5WQ.text: I've been dying to try this place out as I work in the same parking lot, and for the fact that I've met the owner a few times! The pizza is delicious and unique.

QV84hPVkM7JLgvFlb1_QGQ.text: I'll admit it. I can be quite the "pizza-holic" at times. And it just so happened that I was trying quite a few pies during my Phoenix trip last week. Fortunately, I was able to cap it all off with a pilgrimage to one of the greatest pizzerias in America: Pizzeria Bianco.  Of course, we had to wait a while for a table. But when we're talking about pizzas coming directly from the brick oven and made with fresh quality ingredients, the wait is worth it!  Our party tried the Biancoverde, Margherita, Rosa, & Wiseguy Pizzas along with the Tomato & Mozzarella Antipasti Plate. And my goodness, the mozzarella was super creamy! And my goodness, the pizzas! The Rosa blew me away, and I'm not a big onion person. The Margherita definitely met my standards for that classic zesty goodness. And the Biancoverde was a pleasant surprise with a nice, spicy kick from the fresh arugula.  I didn't try the Wiseguy, but the carnivores in our party were somewhat underwhelmed by the fennel sausage. Other than that, no one was really disappointed by Bianco. Oh, and I very much enjoyed my Prosecco cocktail!  All in all, I was quite pleased with what I found and what I tasted at the original Pizzeria Bianco. And I now know why this seemingly humble spot tucked away in a strip mall was won so many culinary awards. It's definitely a "must eat" in PHX!

TulTOIdFyZ_UOsJ2g_5Uag.text: Man I hate to say this cause I love the other location, but this place is overrated and over priced. Paid $48 for a take out salad that was 3 bites and 2 pastas that could only feed one person. Plus the server was rude. I am a big lover of the phoenix restaurant scene, but I will definitely not be spending any more money or time at this joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $12 for 4 pieces of lettuce !!! You have got to be kidding me. A &#34;market&#34; salad my a** I will never be coming back to this place

5HQBBFJZjY8fnR_-8S2SzA.text: Good pizza.  Service was just so so. Sat with empty water and iced tea glasses for most of our meal.

Ry6QeY6CiNTvG-OxUwozzQ.text: Been eating here for years and have never had even one slightly sub-par experience. Really surprised the overall rating isn't higher, it certainly should be.

qAncK_t21flPZbArtLf7qQ.text: Like I ever would have doubted a Chris Bianco inspired concept.  Evidently we ate at a different restaurant then the ones who have peppered Yelp with their 3-Star statements.  I found no tarnish on our five star experience.    The ambiance is comfortable and cozy just like he envisioned.  You do feel like family, especially when Chris is personally visiting each table. Every dish sampled was simple yet elegant and flavorful.  Nothing pretentious, just flawlessly executed family staples.

1CcjUSjnNQAMWL20X3ijNA.text: Amazing pizza, Great service, Locally sourced ingredients! Ugghhhmazing house-made Italian eggnog going on right now as well!  We had the Sonny Boy (my favorite) and the Wise Guy pizzas today. Added roasted garlic to both for an even more flavorful experience!  If you have a chance to grab a meal here I can't recommend them highly enough!

PakeXwBTXeqJK253M_kCKQ.text: I've been coming to Phoenix several times a year for the past five years.  I have heard about Pizzeria Bianco incessently during that time but haven't been able to eat there because I am not willing to wait 2 + hours for pizza, no matter how good it is, unless my waitress is a bikini clad Mila Kunis (and maybe not even then).  However, when I learned they had opened another restaurant right around the corner from the office, I was there at 11:15 am the next day and was able to be seated immediately.  My review is pretty simple: this place totally lives up to the ridiculous hype.  The pizza (Sonny Boy) was amazing, as was the Market Salad (this one had arugula, peaches, walnuts, goat cheese).  Dying to come back and try everything else on the menu.

FUo0WzQzLrfvNedxKHQCdw.text: Amazing menu. The pizza has a delicious and distinct flavor. Definitely in the top 5 of my pizza experience. I'm from philly and haven't a good pie in awhile. This gives any pizza I've had in philly a run for its money. The meatballs as an appetizer was perfect moist and juicy. I highly recommend this establishment with its charming decor.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Market salad
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margarita pizza with fresh organic basil
Photo of Pizzeria Bianco - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage and onion pizza

F07oIrhgererxfYz3_DWhA.text: Nestled in the middle of the Town & Country shopping center is Pizzeria Bianco. There weren't any signs telling you that it was located there so I just happened upon it with some help from great Yelp friends. With all the word of mouth I'd. Heard about this place I was excited to try it.    We met some friends there around six and didn't have a wait to be seated. Being seated at the only round white table there and the short chairs made me feel like I was eating at the little kids table at the family holiday dinners I had as a kid.  The place itself was a little small but they make good use of their space.  The place felt cozy and like it was your second home, with a few unknown strangers dining with you.   Our table though was located a little too close to the door and wood fired oven.    The wait staff was very friendly and answered all questions promptly. She was even able to provide a recommendation on menu choices.  I really like it when the wait staff knows their menu. Although we had to request the bread and oil. The pizza was your typical thin crust fire baked pizza. I ordered the rosa pizza which had onions and pistachios. A very yummy and interesting combination.  The only downside to the evening was the menu itself. There are two pages devoted to wine beer and spirits but only one for food options. There were only 6 pizza options, 2 pasta choices and a few salad options.

xCjEXShzKwk3YvrmjiYOUw.text: Best pizza!!!! If you haven't checked this place out.... Get in there pronto!! Staff is super friendly as well. Great experience

KiBB2b_1owSK7-dU17NdXw.text: I ate at the original location 20yrs ago when it first opened, I remember the food being great and over the years I would see them in Food and Wine and Bon Appetite with great reviews.  I moved to Phoenix and saw they opened this location. I finally decided to eat there for my sons birthday and was extremely disappointed. The service was not that great average if at best. I've had better service at a Denny's. The food was completely over priced it was descent tasting, I can cook just as good if not better than what was on the menu. I won't go here again. Waste of money.

yM-EsxnUflIzG0Dijbu6ZA.text: I really enjoyed this place, and am pretty sad that it isn't more convenient to home (Washington State).  Before I talk about the food we actually ordered, let's talk about the bread course - or more specifically, the olive oil. I am not ashamed to say that after drenching all of the bread (which was also really good) in olive oil, I proceeded to wipe the bowl clean with my finger. Not overly cultured, I know, but absolutely necessary. The tomato undertones in the EVOO made it hard to resist.  We were hungry, having not eaten for the majority of the day, so after polishing off our two plates of bread, we proceeded to dig into our two pizzas - the Sonny Boy, which had red sauce, salami, olives, and cheese, and the special, which had no sauce, lots of cheese, prosciutto, apples, and rosemary. Both were incredible. Also, the crust is perfect - thin, with the chewiness of a thicker crust.  All in all, a great experience. Eat here.

u2983qvb7cNYSjepRO7xSQ.text: We met Chris Bianco at the chipotle music festival a couple of weeks ago, and we were very impressed with his views on food, use of organic ingredients, and thought about sustainability. We decided to check out his restaurant Pizzeria Bianco on 20th street. It was amazing. We tried the pizza margarita and the pizza marinara. They were both excellent. The atmosphere and the restaurant decorations fit the impression that we had made about Chris and his style, very well done! Recommended!

9N5GvpXQmiM3Ej79KrGh5Q.text: After all the great press and awesome reviews ive heard I was looking forward to dining here.  My first thought was that the decor was urban shabby chic meets Goodwill garbage.  Sad but True!  My experience was absolutely disappointing and have no intention of trying it again. We were sat at a small uncomfortable table, with hard wobbly chairs.  Our server stopped by for drink orders however they were out of diet coke, because they only sell it in glass bottles, this was his explanation. Lame!   Once we ordered the pizza, we never saw our server make any other attempt to check on us. Our pizza was dropped off by another server,  and yet it was BURNT, looks and by taste. How do you bring this to the table! I posted a pic as well...This Pizza was tasteless, amd hardly any cheese yet the mushrooms were truly the only compliment i can give and the reason it deserves one star. I really don't understand the hype of this place.  I enjoy gourmet food but i assume alpo has more flavor then our pizza did.  Don't waste your time and money,  there's plenty of other tastey restaurants in that area to choose from.

pUfgdUzv7sOjNLqZzJmyoA.text: I had been wanting to try Italian Restaurant for a few months now and finally got to last Friday night.  Just as Pizzeria Bianco did not disappoint, neither did IR.    The bread (crostini) brought out was delectable.  I literally savored every bite.  I wish I could've eaten a small plate's worth.  The cheese plate is a winning appetizer.  Various types of cheeses, marmalade (little too sweet for my liking, but definitely homemade) to pair with a glass of wine perhaps.  I had the dish with short ribs.  Whew, some of the best, most tender I've ever had!  While I couldn't finish all of my risotto, I made sure not to leave one bite of meat!  Quite flavorful, even if the texture of the risotto was not my favorite.  I also tasted the fettuccine, which the next table over was raving about.  Definitely different with the lemon and not something I would think I would enjoy, but alas I was wrong.   The dining room through the main room is simple yet charming with its mixed and matched chairs and asymmetrically placed light fixtures.  Service was top notch.

7hAnr0Z-ox-VjE4lrn1clg.text: Had one of the best pizzas I've ever had here last week. The wood fired mushrooms are an excellent addition to their perfect margarita pizza. I'd recommend bianco town and country to anyone.

zPy5xvKp7Ji58i_HeuO0WQ.text: Finally had a chance last night to check out this latest Chris Bianco restaurant and so happy I did not wait any longer.    As we walked in the door past the open windows to the kitchen, Chris Bianco himself greeted us like we were long lost friends that he had not seen in awhile.    We were seated immediately and presented menus.  The menu is simple and I like that.  Small Plates, a couple pasta dishes. beer, wine and of course the world famous Pizza.    We started with prosciutto wrapped fontina, at $10 it was seriously delicious.  We then ordered the gnocchi, $18, which was one of the specials of the night.  I can say I have never eaten this dish better anywhere.  We finished with the Wise Guy Pizza $18, featuring Schreiners Fennel Sausage, roasted onion and mozzarella.  If this all sounds incredible, it really was.    The wait staff was spot on, friendly and attentive as expected.    As we left,  the entire kitchen staff gave us a friendly wave goodbye.      Pizzeria Bianco, Highly Recomended...

t6ZjHjYEOFGmQ6Fos0916g.text: I really, really want to give Pizzeria Bianco a better review and rating but I can't.  After all the hype we've heard from people, we stopped in for dinner. We were promptly seated in a tastefully decorated restaurant. Our waiter took our drink order quickly, and we decided to try a margherita pizza. Someone gave us a beautiful little bowl of olives, and I watched our waiter (and other waiters) give various tables bread. I'm not sure if we ordered the wrong thing and it didn't come with bread, or if our waiter was careless, but we never got bread.  Our pizza came out quickly enough but our server didn't give us any plates. After our pizza came out, I watched our waiter try to sell desserts to the table immediately next to us; he definitely saw that we received our food but we had to wait until I flagged down a busboy and asked him to get us some plates before we could eat. This took 3-4 minutes so our pizza was a lukewarm by the time we tried it.  Pizza was so delicious - crispy, thin, beautiful crust, fresh toppings (although I would have liked a few more basil leaves, but that's minor). After sitting around a few minutes longer and trying to catch our waiter's eye, he stopped by to sell us a dessert. We tried the tiramisu, which was excellent - best I've ever had. It came with a little fresh fruit and a beautiful whipped cream. I loved it.  We finally got our bill and left. I didn't like the poor service on part of the waiter, I did not like how cramped the seating is, and there was a gentlemen, perhaps the manager, who walked by a couple tables and loudly greeted regular customers. It's important to also greet new customers and ask how the service and food are; instead, he sat behind us at the bar area and loudly discussed scheduling for the employees. It just didn't make for a nice dinner atmosphere.  I want to try the other location; perhaps the service is better. Overall, beautiful, wonderful food, but subpar service. It'll be awhile before I go back.

XXcq7d8p06yKlZWZ7yCHuQ.text: I heard this place is great yet for some reason they find no need to take your order after ten or so minutes of waiting. Considering we were the ONLY table seated, we decided to leave and go next door. Our order was taken within a minute. Maybe next we will call in our order and then eat there.

fkVYYuWPv4hd9YoTD363_g.text: I've been to the OG Pizzeria Bianco and I have no idea what's wrong with this location. The other one was great! The food was pretty good but the service was horrid. Our waitress was mediocre at best and it was problem after problem with this place. I'll give Pizzeria Bianco one more try but never at this location.

3mSmiSbSmPotFs5JunwrOA.text: I just fell in love with this place.  Great staff, friendly and kind. Bianco was in da' house which added up extra kuddos to the place, specially because one would think that now that he's a rock star he would be arrogant but all the contrary, he was super pleasant and down to earth.  I had the specials of the day which were delicious. Watermelon salad and gnocci with meat.   The gnocci were my very favorite, what a dish!   The desert was made by Bianco's mother herself, which was also superb! A banana tiramisu-like cake that was one of the best deserts I've had lately.   Apparently, Bianco's mother brings desert on Thursdays, keep that in mind.  I tried the wise guy pizza which was also excellent.  I'll be back within two weeks.  If that wasn't enough, the decor and charm of the place is outstanding. Rustic with a touch of elegant.  If I have to define Bianco's concepts I would say he trims the BS and focuses in food quality, which is pretty hard to find, specially in AZ.  An instant favorite for me, for sure.  Cheers!

jZrQBgZCIRaZpDXu3GzYHA.text: I really don't think I'm the target audience for a place like this.  I understand what they're going for with these artisan pizzas but I really would just like a little sauce on my pizza.  Just a little...  The flavors are usually good but the lack of any sauce and more often than not over cooked dough make it hard for me to want to keep coming back to places like this.

J7nHOtQA3UZfKJOq7nHIAg.text: We stopped here on our way to The Boulders...not only was it a short trip from the airport, it broke up the drive to our hotel and was the perfect lunch. The pizza was delicious and the garden salad was a simple and healthy compliment. Our waitress was extremely friendly and they even accommodated our luggage (with no hassle or questions asked).

BRPoZ2Ua7TGRrICyqBaSsQ.text: Nothing more to say about this place than it's a must try.  Amazing food, great food and great service. We ended up going here since the main location on Adams had a 2 hour wait. Lucky for us, the owner and chef, Chris, was at this location. He even came to greet us on his way out to head to the restaurant on Adams.  Go try this place. You won't be disappointed.

dDkR590D4MvHz9mopnrWOA.text: The Town & Country location just didn't compare to the original location downtown for me. I'm not sure if it the overall quality/experience or the anticipation that comes with dining at the downtown location. When you wait 2 hours for food, does it taste better because you are so starving by the time you get it...? I think it was a combination of both. Here is the rundown with our experience at T & C:  Pros: - Obviously, the lack of wait time. We were able to walk right in on at Saturday night at 8:00 pm. - Service was very friendly. Our waiter, the hostess, and even someone from the bar who came by to check on our drinks. -Good wine selection.  Cons: - They don't allow you to split pizzas (half one flavor, half the other). The downtown location does, so we were thrown off by this. -  It is pretty loud and cramped as some other reviews mention. - It might be a seasonal thing, but the olives (as a side order) were not the same as we previously had downtown. The others were the largest, freshest tasting green olives I have ever had in my life. These were more your standard fare olives. -The food came almost eerily fast (about 10 minutes). This makes me a little nervous of how freshly made the orders are. Especially in combination with the fact that they don't customize or allow you to do half pizzas... -We had the Sonny Boy and it was just okay. Great crust, but the overall flavor was not impressive. It also had a very strange odor when they first set it down and similar aftertaste.   I will probably give this another try  to see if the experience is any better, but honestly with so many other amazing pizza options in the Arcadia/Biltmore area, it won't be anytime soon.
